40766150.review:
In a time where cryptocurrency mining is making modern gpus unaffordable for the average consumer, enter Kung Fury Street Rage,  the game that would have been considered "retro" even in the "retro days". Based on the movie which everyone loved and not just because it's free, Kung Fury is the game where you play as the man who got bit by a cobra and struck by lightning at the same time. 

The game itself is simple but entertaining. You have only two buttons, A and D or the left and right arrow, which translates into punching, kicking and killing left and right the waves of enemies that are coming at you. Five enemy types and a leader-board which stars the fictional characters, your steam friends and your possible biggest adversary a.k.a. yourself usually makes it the kind of game that from a couple of minutes can go to endless hours of playtime for most people. It's the kind of game where you don't need to be in the mood to play through and enjoy it. Both in endless mode and story mode you'll play as four characters, each of them playing differently and while that is great the truth is you'll still be most comfortable as playing Kung Fury, since he's the most accessible and fluid in game-play. The others handle different and while you'll master one, the others will still give you pause. 

The story is just as ridiculous as the movie and that's in a good way. It should take you half and hour to play through it, but if you grew up with cinematic games the two-button game-play might feel like "clunky controls" which will cause you troubles from the second stage. For everyone though, the last boss will be a challenge and much like in the games of old or the Dark Souls of nowadays, you'll learn from failure. Luckily, the game has checkpoints, but only when you start a new game and an automated save system, with five different slots which can be overwritten.

The game's visuals will look well since it already looks ancient, but that's your guarantee that you'll run it on everything, every resolution with no performance cost at a 60 fps cap. The background is the same and the soundtrack is limited in then number of tracks but engaging for the fight and ambiental in the way that you won't mind hearing it over and over gain. Besides, the player's focus will be on dealing with the increasing number of nazis which come from each side. 

Fun game and so cheap that you don't have to wait for a sale to buy it. An easy game to recommend I'd say! 

You can watch the movie here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bS5P_LAqiVg or look for it on Steam(still free)

My video review: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ELOTx-E_YYg

40696294.review:
このゲームは、左右から出てくる敵をひたすら倒すゲーム。ゲーム内の基本操作は左右の方向キー（ボタン）のみ。こう書くとスゴく単調なゲームの様に聞こえるが、実際は実に忙しいゲームだ。
その理由は、敵の倒し方が決まっている事。１撃で倒れる敵だけならば単調極まりない反射神経ゲームだが、敵にHP（１～5）があり、更に決まった倒し方（方向キーを押す順番）がある。こうした敵が左右からワラワラと溢れ出てくるので、それに対応したキー操作が実に忙しい。攻撃をミスすると大きな隙が出来る為、基本的に攻撃は当て続けなければならない。（わざと攻撃をミスして仕切りなおす戦術もある）乱戦となった時、どの順番で敵を倒していくかを瞬時に考えながら攻撃を繰り出さなければならないのだ。更に、登場キャラクター（４人）にはそれぞれ個性があり、敵の倒し方も変わってくる。
攻略としては、各敵の倒し方を覚え、敵が射程距離に入る所に先行入力でキーを押しておく事。全てがタイミングよく決まった時の爽快感は格別だ。
ストーリーモードとエンドレスモードが存在し、ストーリーモードではボスが登場する。ここでも基本は左右の方向キーしか使わないので、ボスの動きを読んで倒そう。エンドレスモードは、その名の通りひたすら敵を倒すだけのモード。
単純操作ながら、実に奥深く遊べる良質ゲームだ。
細かい事だが、敢えてブラウン管をイメージした画面と、ゲーム開始時やコンティニュー時にコイン投入の音を鳴らす等、昔のアーケードゲームを感じさせる演出は、当時を知る身としては気分が盛り上がる。

40631064.review:
this is more akin to one fist death punch than say a final fight.
here you hit left attack or right attack to hit enemies on the respective side but then they change it up to double taping the attack on bosses so as to let you move to avoid things. this happens without telling the player so it took me a few tries to figure out how to even attack the boss.
deaths also feel very cheap because if you get more than one enemy on one side your main attack will only hit 1 of them so the other(s) will most likely hit you. with only able to take a few hits you'll go down fast do to this. 

i beat contra (with 3 lives) and battle toads and deaths felt deserved. this fad of "git gud" retro games is just sad. devs can't make a good level/enemy design so they take a page out of snk's fighting games and use cheap tactics to prolong game play then try to pass it off as "hard". if it was just the gang up tactic i could overlook it because many beat'm up game suffer from this (though most of them let you hit every enemy within your attacks hitbox) but to totally rework controls during bosses without telling the player is just unforgivable. this tactic only serves to add "WTF do i do" time to the game making it seem longer than it is. in an age of no manuals not having a text or warning about boss fights in just bad dev work.

39547507.review:
This is actually really fun. Very similar to One Finger Death Punch except more focused on beating several waves plus a boss which constitutes a level.

The only complaint is the bosses which feel like a drag on the entire game due to unresponsive and confusing controls. During boss fights, you can freely move around the level scene so the combat controls change but the game never tells you the remapped controls for boss mode. In one of the boss fights, you need to hit something that the enemy is throwing with your axe using split-second timed accuracy. Well, the button for using your axe doesn't do anything until that instantaneous moment occurs and you aren't sure which button to use. So in order to figure out how to fight the boss, you need to assume that you have to hit those things to defeat it and try every button with the exact timing in hopes of some kind of feedback. As it turns out, to add to the confusion of figuring out how to fight bosses, a) there's two attack buttons which are positional based on whether the enemy is to your left or right and b) hitting the button once almost has no noticable effect and must be often combo'ed like 3x for what seems like a normal successful hit. Once you actually figure out the controls, it starts to get a bit fun; however, unlike the rest of the non-boss levels, they still tend to feel unfair since sometimes the controls seem to not act as expected.

Update:
Played more bosses. They all still suck so far. The boss fights are such a disappointment in comparison to the rest of the game.

38980396.review:
It's a decent "two-button" beat'em up that emphasizes timing and rhythm instead of actual control of your characters. There's a boring story mode and an endless mode. The pixel art is stylish albeit undercooked and underdeveloped.

The game uses a fake CRT monitor effect which you can't turn off and even though there have been many games that use this kind of filter for that "retro" feel, the one here is probably the most obscenely obtrusive and downright headache inducing I've ever experienced. It distorts the view to such degree that it isn't fun to look at for more than short periods of time. 

Music was forgettable and the comedy and characters, although with promise, never deliver even if you're a fan of the source material.

All in all, skip this game. It's shallow and not so fun to play. The visuals were problematic for me and there isn't much of a game in there that would warrant interest. Feels like what a free mobile game should be.

38961782.review:
Kung Fury: Street Rage is the Dark Souls of the One Finger Death Punch style genre.
No hud to tell you how far the enemies are. (This makes for a more immersive and challenging gaming experience) 
This game has an 80's arcade retro art style to it.
Funny storyline just like the movie.
You get to play as different movie characters through the storyline mode.

The whole vibe of this game took me back to the tube tv plug and play console days. 

For $1.49 it's a really good and solid game. If you're a fan of the Kung Fury movie this is a must have. 
Recommended if you're looking for a cheap and fun little time killer.

38324852.review:
Simple. Time consuming. Easy to learn; hard to master. 

Quick Tips:

- Count your hits and keep track on how many hits enemies have taken
- Time your hits to minimize misses
- Hitting an enemy slows time for a few milliseconds - use that to quickly plan the next attack
- Take time to learn the distance of your character's attacks
- Take time to learn the style of gameplay particular to that character
- Take breaks if you aren't making progress

Cheats:

- If you have a steam controller, make two of those buttons turbo versions so you can't get caught off guard by the boss battles.

COOLS:
+ Pure KUNG FURY style.
+ This includes humour, artstyle, setting and music.
+ What little control you have feels responsive.
+ Cheap / Great way to support the fantasic movie, which is free to watch here ons Steam!

NOT-SO-COOLS:
- Short
- Not a traditional beat-em-up, can be hard to get into.

Just like the game, keeping it short and sweet. You wanna try something new and liked Kung Fury the movie? Then I recommend this! It's only 3 bucks!

I thought this might be a promising Double Dragon ripoff but it's not. 

It's a clicker game which just looks like it's a 1990's game ripoff but contains even less actual gameplay, as you simply need to attack left or right repeatedly to pass through each wave.   When the gameplay is limited to two button presses, something has gone wrong in the design and conceptualisation phase. 

Also it has some faux CRT filter over it which distorts the text and you can't turn it off... game settings are almost as non-existent as the actual gameplay. 

Very disappointing overall.  There are some good Double Dragon clones out there, and because they exist, my thumbs up for this game doesn't.

35711517.review:
A damn fun game with high replayability. It's got a short but hard campaign, and I haven't beat it yet, but it's okay if you're not able to beat it. It has an "Endless" mode which is just about you trying to beat your own high score while you defeat waves and waves of Nazis. It's great fun in short bursts, works best when you got a minute or two while you wait for a queue in another multiplayer game or you just need to go. 

Key element is simplicity with just two buttons to attack on either side but very challenging and  fun gameplay. A better version of One Finger Death Punch with nice retro graphics and sound. 

If you're still skeptical about buying this, just try out the free version on your Android phone. This PC version though was way more fun than the mobile version because it was smoother and easier.

35624394.review: Jogo voltado apenas aos fãs mesmo, Kung Fury: Street Rage possui a mesma mecânica de combate do One Finger Death Punch (usa apenas 2 botões, ataque/direita e ataque/esquerda), porém você pode movimentar-se na horizontal e isso acaba deixando o jogo bem mais fácil pq ao errar você pode tentar fugir do golpe e depois contra-atacar. Sobre o jogo, ele em si é bem fraquinho mesmo, gosto da mecânica de combate do One Finger Death Punch, mas no Kung Fury: Street Rage tudo ficou bem meia-boca, outro problem é a falta de conquistas e o personagem hackerman (cada personagem ataca de uma forma diferente) que é horrível e estragou o modo story.

35076925.review:
Kung Fury: Street Rage is the perfect fusion between the free movie [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/374570/Kung_Fury/]Kung Fury[/url] and the game [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/264200/One_Finger_Death_Punch/]One Finger Death Punch[/url]. If you enjoyed both of those things, then not much else needs to be said.

The gameplay is very simple; controlled entirely with two buttons (left and right), you fend off waves of Nazi enemies by attacking left and right. It's simple, but gets difficult rather quickly, requiring patience and endurance; button mashing will get you killed. There are four characters to choose from, and they all play slightly differently but with the same overall premise of use left-and-right to attack.

One thing that I'd like to note is that there is [i]no options menu at all.[/i] No options to adjust audio, toggle fullscreen, change the resolution, remap controls, etc.

I recommend Kung Fury: Street Rage because it captures all the vibes of Kung Fury (complete with voice acting from the cast) and is easy to pick up and play for short periods of time. I never found myself playing this for more than 20~30 minute increments.

34625121.review:
ストーリーモードクリア。
２ボタンのみ仕様の格闘アクション風ゲーム。似たようなゲーム性のものは数種類あるが、その中でも爽快感高い方。
とてもシンプルに構成されていて、プレイヤーは向かってくる敵の種類、方向、そして間合いを見てボタンを押していくことになる。
特にこの『間合い』が重要で、方向が有っていても距離が離れすぎていると空振りしてしまい、反撃を受ける可能性が格段に高い。しかし、間合いの見極めができるようになると、ふとした瞬間に『覚醒』状態に入り気持ちいいくらいに敵を捌けるようになる。
作り自体はシンプルながら、用意された四人のキャラクターごとに全く違った挙動が搭載されており、キャラクターを変えることで新しいプレイ感覚になるのも楽しい。
ゲーム性以外の部分でもあけーどゲームライクなストライプ表現、おかしなキャラクターたちの織り成す会話とストーリー（日本語未対応なのが悔やまれる）など、バカゲー風ながらしっかりと魅力のあるデザインになっている。
もし、覚醒状態になったことプレイヤーがこのレビューを見ていたなら一言。
このゲームはファイナルファイトのような攻撃ボタンを連打することが最上のゲームではなく、敵を『攻撃回数』と捉えて正確にその回数分攻撃していくことが重要なのである。

33629603.review:
Кунг Фьюри это крутая пародия на старые игры с аркадных автоматов. Хорошая стилизация и приятная пиксельная графика. Да, в ней по сути всего две действующие клавиши, 5 видов врагов и полтора вида боссов, так-как босс по сути всего один, но в конце он перевоплащается в другого босса, хотя большинство атак теже. 4 играбельных персонажа и 5 уровней в стори моде, который можно пройти меньше, чем за час. Также в ней есть режим выживания на фарм очков, причём изначально в данной игре был только этот режим. Поэтому если вы уже прошли стори мод, а так хочется ещё поиграть, вы можете попробовать поставить новый рекорд и поверьте, на деле это не так просто как на словах. Ошибка большинства игроков в том, что они рассматривают данную игру как полноценную, коей она не является, ибо по сути данная игра является доп.продакшеном к одноимённой короткометражке, которую, кстати, всем советую посмотреть. Нужно воспринимать эту игру как кружку или футболку из магазина какого-нибудь видеоблоггера, а не как полноценный проект под именнитым издательством. Стоит она всего 79 рублей, и поверьте мне, эти 79 рублей она точно стоит! Крутейший тайм-киллер, который также доступен на айос и андроид устройствах. К слову в этой игре я провёл времени больше, чем в большинстве полноценных, поэтому моя итоговая оценка 6 из 10.

Видео-обзор можно посмотреть тут: https://youtu.be/FwNQXlVmHVE

Bin sehr positiv überrascht :-)
Ich habe dieses Spiel zwar für spaßig, aber nicht lange motivierend gehalten.
Klar ist, dass man für den kleinen Preis nicht viel Spielinhalt erwarten soll, sondern es eher ein kurz(weilig)er Spaß sein soll. Wichtig ist auch, dass man KEIN klassisches, sidescrollendes Beat 'em Up erwarten soll.
Aufgrund des hohen Schwierigkeitsgrades hängt man natürlich trotzdem eine Weile drin, selbst wenn man nur wenig Fortschritt sehen möchte, ABER: das Ganze ist kaum frustrierend oder langweilig, sondern es macht auch beim zwanzigsten Mal noch Spaß, den richtigen Flow zu finden!
Man hat sogar einen kleinen Storymodus, der alle vier Charaktere (Kung Fury, Barbarianna, Hackerman, Triceracop) einbindet. Jeder hat seine eigenen Feinheiten in der Bewegung, die man an die Gegner anpassen sollte. Außerdem gibt's natürlich mit Fortschritt den ein oder anderen neuen Gegnertyp, welcher robuster daherkommt und anders gemeistert werden muss. Und schon wird im Gesamtkonzept (Zusammenspiel der Gegner) sowas wie eine Taktik erforderlich.

Spätestens zum Ende hin wird es bockschwer. Ich mit meinen bald 40 Lenzen hab für's letzte Level und den Boss satte drei Tage gebraucht, aber es ist möglich^^ Uff!
(glaub an dich :-)

Müßig zu erwähnen ist wohl, dass das Ganze, basierend auf dem Film, eine äußerst gelungene, herrlich abgedreht-trashige Hommage an mein Lieblingsjahrzehnt ist :D

31961701.review:
While sporting very very and I mean VERY nice retro style graphics (if you love 80s you MUST own this!) and easy-to-learn mechanics based on just 2 keys, I am really sad to give KF:SR a thumbs down. 

As many have already pointed out, the game gets far too difficult far too quickly: first two waves are easy, third is hard, then you think you did it but (surprise!) you discover there's one more wave before you pass the level, and you have to be hyperlightining quick with your fingers, to the point of blindly pushing left/right when you are surrounded. Just 3 hearts (first character, the others get from two to five), no extra whatsoever: get touched three times by enemies and it's back from the start, over and over again. 

While it's always enjoyable in short bursts, thanks to its peculiar rhythm and pacing, frustration takes away most of the fun if you want to beat every level and see the end.

31308413.review:
Prepara tus dedos, porque vas a necesitarlos para repartir mamporros entre oleadas de enemigos, tanto Nazis, enfermeras peleonas, personajes cabezones e incluso Robots, entre mucha calaña más, cada cual más difícil.

Kung Fury: Street Rage, cuando una mecánica sencilla conjuga pura diversión

Este título entra por los ojos, oídos y la nostalgia por los años 80 que ya nos dejaron, aunque ahora parece que han vuelto aquellos años. Por ser más claros y entrar en materia, Kung Fury: Street Rage es el juego oficial de la película o medio-metraje del mismo nombre, que fue financiada por crowdfunding como un homenaje a todo lo que nos gustaba de los años 80.

Kung Fury: Street Rage es algo así como el videojuego oficial de la película, con un apartado gráfico muy llamativo, incluso con filtro para simular la pantalla de una máquina Arcade de los extintos recreativos que proliferaban en cualquier esquina por aquel entonces.

La mecánica del título es muy simple, tan solo será necesario utilizados dos teclas (izquierda,derecha), la izquierda para atacar a los enemigos que vengan por ese lado y derecha para lo mismo pero al revés. Eso sí, no será todo tan sencillo, ya que el “timing” que deberás llevar está bien medido, por lo que no todo será pulsar a lo loco y algunos enemigos necesitarán de varios golpes para ser demolidos a golpes o incluso disparos, en ocasiones. Al final parece más un juego musical, de ritmo, que un propio juego de acción.

Pero es quizás esta mecánica tan simple es el mayor acierto de Kung Fury: Street Rage, acompañado de un apartado gráfico muy resultón, muy Arcade y sobre todo su soberbia banda sonora, que le queda como un guante y no nos imaginamos el juego sin otra.

Si hay que destacar algo de Kung Fury: Street Rage es su estética ochentera, su regusto añejo y sobre todo su jugabilidad y diversión directa, compraló te aseguro que no te arrepentiras.

Nota: 9,5/10

31224803.review: just bought this to support the makers of kunf fury, still is a nice game, good for 10 or 15 min break of studying

31042296.review:
Después de jugar 5 minutos a Kung Fury estaba totalmente decepcionado, ¿como puede ser que un juego moderno utilice solo 2 botones?, me esperaba un Streets of Rage y me encuentro un juego moderno de mecánicas absurdamente simples.. pero había visto bastantes buenas críticas (que no leído, sinceramente) y tampoco soy de tirar la toalla rápido así que me obligué a continuar... y es increíble cuán equivocado estaba con el juego xD el planteamiento es totalmente diferente a todo lo que he jugado, y eso habla bien de su originalidad, por asimilarlo a algo podría ser a Crypt Of The Necrodancer, donde realmente no estamos luchando contra los enemigos, estamos “bailando” con ellos, aprendiendo sus movimientos para defendernos rápido en cuanto vuelvan sus clones a por nosotros, así que básicamente es un juego de resistir hordas seguidas de un jefe final, en el que se premian los combos, es decir encadenar el mayor número de movimientos sin cometer un error, algo francamente divertido ya que el juego está lleno de detalles y la curva de dificultad va claramente en aumento, además siempre se nos muestra el número de hordas restantes y de enemigos por eliminar lo que ayuda a no querer dejar de jugar. Su estética no se limita a ser retro sino que los gráficos están realmente trabajados, con un pixel art bastante cuidado, con un efecto que imita un CRT (scanlines, curvatura, quemado y colores desgastados) a la perfección, música pegadiza, etc. y si ya vimos la película en que está basado el juego (disponible gratuitamente en Steam) veremos muchos detalles que nos recuerdan a ella, aparte de consolidar la historia, creando así un universo conectado y coherente.

Si te gustan los juegos de estilo arcade donde el reto está en irse superando a cada partida, posiblemente te va a gustar.

30875471.review:
I haven't played this game for 7 hours. I idled it for the cards.

Anyway this game plays like a lesser One Finger Death Punch. It has several flaws:

It's much too difficult much too quickly. You have to go on for far too long before you reach a [insert swear word] checkpoint (when will programmers realise that these are unnacceptable on a PC)? It means the game is infuriating and is almost ruined because of it (just like most other games that use it). 30284073.review:
This game isn't at all what I expected. First of all: it's not a beat 'em up; it's a two button quicktime game throughout, including the menus.
Going through the story mode, you switch between each playable character fighting rounds of enemies. If you lose durring a wave, you start from the first wave which is entirely aggravating since it becomes so much slower than the wave you were just on.
When you complete the set amount of waves, you encounter the arcade boss, which controls like garbage. You have to avoid its projectiles and explosions by moving left and right, but the problem is the buttons to move are the same buttons to attack, so when you try to avoid the boss's attacks, you end up attacking nothing and then get hit.
I think this would have been a great idea for a beat 'em up, but that's not what this game delivers. Just watch the short film; it's funny and free, you'll get way more enjoyment out of it than you would with this game.

30218320.review:
Worth. Every. Penny.

Anyone with a pulse and any sense of fun will find themselves saying "One more try..."

No intricate gameplay mechanics, just you and your trusty left and right attacks. No movement, no special moves, no powerups, no health recovery. You can attack as fast as you can click the buttons, but button mashing will break your chain and leave you vulnerable to the closest attacker. Use the mouse, or keyboard, or gamepad, it makes little difference. No fancy story line either, just some good quality intermission voice acting from the original cast of the movie no less! The only person missing is the Hoff 9000... that sonofabitch!

As you play through "story" mode, you will unlock a few different characters from the movie, who have slight variations on the simple style of the game. [spoiler]Kung Fury (Level 1) is the only character with 3 hearts. Barbarianna (Level 2) has an awesome 4-hit buildup to a left or right screen clearing gatling gun attack. Hackerman (Level 3) has a stun attack that builds up to "hacking" and then can basically one-shot kill everything, and each kill extends the hacking-time. This is as far as I have made it in the story mode, but I have it on good authority that Triceracop is Level 4. I wonder if he shoots everyone in the balls? UPDATE: Just beat Hackerman's level and got to Triceracop the other day. Triceracop gets FIVE hearts and yes, he shoots everyone in the balls, but only at close range.[/spoiler] While the characters add a nice variation to the game, there is no re-learning how to fight with different combos or special moves, only adapting to each character's style.

Bought this origially after seeing the (30 minute) "movie" on Netflix. [u][i][b]Watch it.[/b][/i][/u] Then watch it again and laugh at all the parts you missed laughing at because you were laughing so hard at so many things the first time. Neither the game nor the movie take themselves seriously, which is really cool. If you can step back for a second and do the same, you will have a blast watching or playing. They both have the feel of something made 30 years ago, and that is something very special, because you usually only get that with something made about 30 years ago...

29615157.review:
[h1]Kung Fury:[/h1] 
Это необычная игра в стиле beat'em up, здесь есть всего две кнопки управления (влево и вправо), но даже при таком простом, как можно подумать, раскладе игра кажется очень хардкорной. Честно признаться я даже не прошел её до конца... но покупка стоила того. Как только вы запустите Kung Fury, поймете о чем я. Один лишь саундтрек и короткий вступительный ролик заставляет улыбаться, ведь это ретро-классик. А вся стилистика в стиле древних приставок... возникает чувство будто бы ты играешь в старый игровой автомат. В общем, это дико круто. Так же порадовало наличие какого-никакого сюжета, где вам предстоит оказаться в неизвестной петле времени и выбраться из неё, собрав все чипы у злобного робота. Плюсуем разнообразие игровых персонажей с разными способностями и стилем игры. Единственное чего не хватает, так это может быть разнообразия в режимах, может быть даже других уровней (локаций), но здесь я, конечно, придираюсь.

Подводя итоги: Эта простенькая игра всего лишь на пару вечеров, но зато сколько удовольствия она вам принесет. Однозначно игра стоит своих денег и даже если вам жалко $1, возьмите её на скидки, не пожалеете.

Оценка: 9 чипов из 10

29084303.review:
[h1]A Simple, Yet Fun Game[/h1]

Let me start off saying that there isn't much [b]depth[/b] in this game. You simply control characters from "Kung Fury" and press the right and left arrow buttons to attack enemies. If you're a fan of the film, you'll definitely get a few laughs/smiles out of the game. The characters you know and love from the film (which you can view on Netflix, the last I checked) are here again, except they're [b]trapped within the arcade machine[/b]! 

You fight through waves of enemies (or, if playing the "Endless" mode, a never-ending wave of enemies) by pressing the arrow buttons back and forth to hit them. Some enemies will teleport, others require multiple hits, some are faster than others.. you get the idea. There isn't really much beyond this. It's a simple game that's designed in a way that should appeal to fans of the film, even if for about 20-30 minutes (or for as long as you really care to engage with the game in general). 

If you're okay with how the game plays and it's "lack of depth" - I actually suggest this game. Just don't expect it to be the "best game" or even one that you'll find yourself playing for 110+ hours nonstop (at least, not easily).

29037716.review:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Spiel: 

Ein sehr schwerer One Finger Death Punch Klone im Retro Style und Story.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Einzelspieler:

Man spielt Kung Fury oder einen seinen Freunde die gegen die Nazis kämpfen. Das Kampfsystem ist sehr einfach, es wird mit Zwei Tasten gespielt eine von beiden ist für links die andere für rechts. Die Moves werden automatisch ausgeführt. Dann muss man nur noch die Drei Wellen Gegner schaffen und man kommt in das nächste Level.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Grafik:

Die Grafik hat einen schönen Retro Charme, und passt perfekt dazu. Dennoch hätte ich eine paar Einstellungsmöglichkeiten schön gefunden.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musik:

Die Musik ist sehr passend gehalten zum Spiel.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Steuerung:

Die Steuerung sehr gut mit dem Xbox Pad, dennoch ist das Timing sehr schwer zu finden.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pro/Contra:

+ sehr schöne Idee
+ Super Synchro
+ schöne Charaktere
- langweiliges Kampfsystem
- viel zu schwer

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Fazit:

Ich hatte mir etwas mehr vorgestellt bei diesem Spiel, es hätte mehr Spass gemacht wenn es wirklich eine richtiges Beat’em Up gewesen wäre im Stile von Streets of Rage und Co. Die Figuren sind ja alle ganz schön aber der Schwierigkeitsgrad ist für meine Verhältnisse zu enorm. Für mich wäre es ein nettes Gratis Game aber 2,99€ist es mir nicht wert gewesen, da kucke ich lieber den Film Gratis.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Zusammengefasst: 

Einzelspieler: 4/10
Grafik: 8/10
Musik: 7/10
Steuerung: 10/10
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Spiel: 7/10

28795374.review:
This game is particularly impressive. I was actually surprised by how playable and challenging this game is. Not only does it feature the original characters and soundtrack of Kung Fury (Power Move, anyone?), it also made an outstanding job at making a decent game with only two buttons as the main input, without turning into a smash-buttons-to-win kind of game. In fact, missing an attack incurs too high a penalty to just smash buttons at random, so you just have to know when to punch them and how frequently.

Here's my summary of ups and downs:

 + Cool retro style graphics with virtual CRT screen, without being too demanding or getting in the way.
 + Kill stuff with the sound of cool synth wave from the film's soundtrack.
 + An interesting variety of characters to choose from.
 + Fast but "think-before-you-smash" kind of game: slay hundreds of nazis without getting hit.
 + Utterly cheap: bought it on a sale for one and a half euro.
 + The new story mode provides a lot more gameplay, voice acted dialogues and inside jokes.
 + Thor's pecs are epic.

 - Can become difficult and frustrating in the long run, as levels in the story mode become harder and longer.
 - Wave 6 / 7
 - Wave 6.5 / 7
 - Wave 6.75 / 7
 - Wave Finale
 - GAH! Game over! 9 nazis left...

28710932.review:
[h1]Review verfasst am 27.12.2016[/h1]

Kung Fury: Street Rage ist ein Beat'em up. Obwohl das Game 2015 rauskam, fühlt es sich sehr Retro an.
Grund dafür ist der Sound und die Grafik, die einem suggeriert vor einem Arcade Automaten zu sitzen.
Anfangs war ich sehr begeistert von dem Spiel, doch leider wurde meine Freude etwas gedämpft,
weil das Spiel so schwer ist. 

Zu sagen wäre noch, dass vier verschiedene Kämpfer auswählbar sind, welche sich in Kampfart,

28595652.review:
We need some action if we're gonna make it like a true survivor!

This game has Divekick's simplistic mechanics, as it only has two buttons for attacking opponents on the left and right.  The point of the game here is to time your button presses to kill the hordes of Nazis, robots, and ninjas.  One mistimed button press will cause you to miss and be hit akin to a rhythm game.

As far as the story goes the game picks up on what the movie has left off, where Hitler (aka Kung Fuhrer) time-traveled to the present to unleash havoc and it's up to Kung Fury and his ragtag bunch of misfits to stop him.

Joining Kung Fury are Triceracop who's his partner in the police department, Barbarianna who's a viking with a gatling gun, and Hackerman who's the greatest hacker of all time.  Each of them have different play mechanics so better learn how their moves work so you won't miss on your button presses.

In terms of atmosphere the game completely oozes of the arcade era and the 80s, in which I have a vague memory of.  The millennials should see how the 80s look like.

With the game's simplicity and nice appeal as well as its cheap price, this should be a good buy.

28300888.review:
For $3.29, you could do worse. Kung Fury is an excellent little movie and this game does it a lot of justice. 

It plays exactly like the awesome stick figure brawler 'One Finger Death Punch', in that the game only runs on two buttons. Enemies will approach from the left and the right, and you press the corresponding buttons to attack. There are several enemies, which take anywhere from one hit up to five hits to defeat, with a couple of them teleporting from side to side. The game throws them at you in different groups so you're always on your toes. 

There are two modes to this game, the first one being story. This involves you fighting waves of enemies as each of the games characters in four chapters, with a special boss fight at the end of each chapter where you actually get to move around normally. Each of the battles is different and escalates in difficulty with the boss adapting new moves each time. The story mode also features short dialogue scenes containing the actual voice actors from the flim, which is enjoyable but there isn't as much dialogue as there could've been. 

Endless Mode is the second one on offer, and is basically just what it says; an endless wave of enemies for you to fight against until you die, fighting for a high score all the while. Depending on how much you enjoy the game will determine your mileage on this. 

What is different from the aforementioned title this borrows from, is the fact that each character is different. 

**You have KUNG FURY of course, who plays rather ordinary with some flashy kung-fu moves, and three health. No fancy mechanics to him oddly enough.

**Then you have BARBARIANNA, who attacks normally with her axe and blasts everything on one side with her gatling gun every fifth hit, and only two health for some reason. 

**Next up is HACKERMAN, who has to attack or 'hack' four times to charge up his attack, at which point he can actually destroy every enemy on the screen with one hit each as long as you keep attacking to keep it charged. 

**Lastly is TRICERACOP, who fights similarily to Kung Fury but with guns, and in the process actually shifts backwards on each attack so you can get all the enemies on one side or the other, and he has five health altogether. 

Each one of these characters plays differently enough to keep the game interesting. For the cost of the game you can get your money's worth. So get this game, go hack and beat up some Nazis and have a nostalgia filled good time.

I believe the actors from the short film provide voicework as well, and it is all presented in a professional manner.  If you liked this game, try out One Finger Death Punch. Alternatively if you liked that game, you'll like this as well.

虽然只有两个键的游戏，但是非常考验玩家的反应和预判能力。有玩家觉得很枯燥很简单，那是因为没有打通故事模式。特别是boss战极大程度是看脸的，除非你有神一样的预读和欧洲人的血统；不过某个角色太IMBA了。没错，就是黑客兄弟。我在无尽模式用黑客打出了50万+（我的图库有截图）相比其他角色在攻击等级较高的敌人（如金色头发的小哥要攻击两次、跆拳道妹子要攻击3次、机器人要攻击4次以及那个在电影一开始就被主角杀死的“忍者大师“，要攻击5次{笑}）需要攻击多次来说，黑客攻击的次数是大大减少了很多。这真的是太HACK了会用三角龙风骚走位不miss的才叫厉害。[；spoiler]毕竟是女主角（电影好像没表白，为何在游戏里对主角表白。这是制作组的恶意么…… 	[/spoiler]

But for what it is, a game about speed, reaction time, deducing what order you should attack which enemies (different enemies require a different amount of hits, & different playable characters have 'special attacks' that are prepared after you land so many consecutive hits), & for £1.99, it's fun. The retro synth & chiptune sound, pixel graphics & presentation are consistent with the movie this is based on, as is the story, the characters, & the characters voices.

24065930.review:
Gran cambio tras la actualización, el juego mejoró en su principal fallo, el cual era la falta de contenido.
PRO:
-Jugabilidad simple y adictiva (excluyendo las peleas de los bosses)
-curva de dificultad muy buena (mejorada tras la actualización)
-un genial modo historia que te recuerda mucho a la película
-música genial y muy acorde al tema retro del juego
-ambientación arcade MUY lograda (tanto en gráficos, como en música y experiencia de juego)
-Variedad de personajes con estilos diferentes tras la misma premisa del fácil control

CONTRAS:
-La historia es algo corta y sin dificultad tras jugar un rato
-las peleas de los bosses suelen ser algo frustrantes por el control que se cambia tras comenzar esas peleas.
-... en realidad es todo lo malo que veo xD

Sugerencias: Agregar logros y cromos de Steam, eso aumentaría la popularidad.

Conclusión: a mí criterio, por lo que el juego busca ofrecer y lo que da, es un 9/10, no es perfecto, pero lo que quisieron ofrecer con un juego arcade retro, raya la perfección.

23896807.review:
Выйдя в свет, Kung Fury разорвал шаблоны просто всему что можно. Снятый за гроши, это одновременно абсурдный театр бреда и мозгового насилия, и невероятно эффектного боевика, играющего на самый тонких чувствах - на ностальгии. 
 
Фильм возвращал (тех, кто застал) зрителя в эпоху VHS и видеосалонов, игра тоже не стала далеко ходить. Наверняка многие застали времена игровых автоматов, и наверняка они помнят, как вокруг них собиралась толпа орущей мелочи, всячески подбадривая и выкрикивая что и когда нажимать двум чувакам за пультами управления. Это были не просто весёлые игрульки, а серъёзное противостояние, во время которого противники выстраивали многоходовые комбо, пытались контратаковать, предугадать ход, а когда на экране высвечивались заветные K.O., толпа взрывалась рёвом и чествовала победителя. 

Примерно то же самое творится и в Kung Fury: Street Rage, за исключением того, что играть придётся в одиночку.
Имея в запасе незамысловатый геймплей (нажимать всего 2 кнопки) и играя за знакомых персонажей, мы будем истреблять нацисткую нечисть, прямиком взятую из фильма. И уже через полчаса игры мы уже не будем, условно говоря, видеть врагов. Мы будем видеть количество кликов мышью, надвигающихся на нас: "лево-право-трижды лево-право-лево-право, так, дважды право приближается, чёрт, ударили! 2 жизни! Так, не расслабляемся!" - так можно описать игровой процесс, причём, просто бездумно кликая мышью, вы  очень быстро увидите на экране "Game Over". Игра заставляет если не выстраивать стратегию боя, то очень быстро адаптироватсья под всё прибывающий шквал врагов, дабы набрать максимальное комбо. Да, вы рано или поздно умрёте, но, чёрт возьми, как приятно видеть своё имя на доске почёта, обойдя тех, кто ещё недавно внушал ужас своими набранным очками.

Кто-то скажет, игра слишком примитивна и не стоит своих денег. Я же скажу, что я и многие другие в детстве, пребывая в залах игровых автоматов после школы, спускали на такое в разы больше. И совершенно не жалко отдать предложенную сумму за возможность окунуться в ушедшую пору.

23119029.review:
"One Finger Death Punch" but with a more pleasing audio and visual design. Runs at a solid 60fps. It feels good on a 360 controller and I reccomend the left thumb stick. 4 playable characters, including my personal favourite, Barbarianna. Story mode with waves and boss fights where you play as each of the 4 characters in turn. Expect memes and references from the 70's. I prefer this game to "One Finger Death Punch", it simplifies the formula even more, has far superior presentation, and lets you play as a female viking complete with bikini armour, battleaxe and minigun.

Antes de mais nada, >esse jogo foi atualizado<, agora tem 4 personagens (cada um deles com características diferentes; seja quantidade de HP ou habiulidades especiais diferentes, o que muda o modo com que você distribui seu combos contra os nazist as digitais) e um modo história, além do modo sem fim original.

Esse jogo é tão simples quanto divertido. Se você gosta de jogos que simplesmente querem reflexos esse jogo é pra você. O modo história segue a mesma linha de "lógica" e humor do filme, o que garante aquele estímulo certo pra continuar destruindo waves e waves até você lembrar que tem coisa melhor pra fazer.

O novo modo história também obriga o jogador a usar todos os 4 personagens alternadamente. Hackerman tem que carregar antes de atirar (um tipo de charge básico/clássico, baseado em quick tap), mas depois que carrega; Barbariana tem um especial no lugar do último golpe do combo, Triceracop simplesmente tem mais HP; E todos já conhecemos o Kung Fury.

Eu diria que vale a pena sim o preço, se você curte um jogo simples de bater infinitamente em infinitos inimigos onde a única dificuldade é ter reflexos rápidos o bastente (e vão por mim, a dificuldade vai aumentando beeem rápido.

22636381.review:
[h1]Atmosphäre[/h1]
Ich war nie ein Fan von "Street Fighter" oder "Mortal Kombat", doch durch sein wunderbares 80er-Flair hat dieses Spiel für mich einen ganz eigenen Reiz. Die Begeisterung, die der Film "Kung Fury" in mir geweckt hat, wurde vom Spiel nicht enttäuscht. Neben der vollkommenen Arcade-Automaten-Aufmachung könnte natürlich auch der Synthpop nicht besser passen. Besonders der Bluescreen als Pausenbildschirm hat etwas für sich...

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Die Steuerung mit nur zwei Tasten (links und rechts) mag anfangs doch etwas zu simpel wirken, allerdings legt das Spiel den Fokus auf saubere Combos und Reaktionsschnelle. Hinzu kommt, dass sich die vier Charaktere in ihrer Steuerung stark unterscheiden, was das Spiel erstaunlich anspruchsvoll und vielseitig macht.

[h1]Schwächen[/h1]
Das Spiel ist sehr minimalistisch gehalten. Ok, auf der einen Seite gibt dies einen Pluspunkt für die Authentizität als Arcade-Spiel. Andererseits hat das Spiel einige Potentiale, seine Vielfalt und damit seine Kurzweiligkeit zu verbessern:
Wechselnde Hintergrundszenerien wären z.B. schick: Man kämpft immer in derselben Straße. Außerdem hat mir ein Tutorial gefehlt, das einen in die gewöhnungsbedürftige Steuerung der Charaktere einführt. "Learn by doing" hat bei mir zwar auch geholfen, jedoch ist es mitunter frustrierend, ein Level an die 20 Mal zu spielen, bevor man weiterkommt.

[h1]Fazit[/h1]
Diese Kritikpunkte sind aber eher Kleinigkeiten. Für seinen Preis von 2,99€ hätte ich mir nicht mehr vom Spiel wünschen können. Ich möchte das Spiel allen ans Herz legen, denen der Film genauso gefallen hat wie mir. Auch als einfacher Pausenfüller kann das Spiel super herhalten. ;)

LG Karscher

22598261.review:
Kung Fury: Street Rage – файтинг-аркада, созданная по мотивам одноименной короткометражки. В Street Rage главным героем является тот самый бескомпромиссный мастер по имени Kung Fury, сумевший не только научить уму-разуму целую толпу нацистов, но и сразиться с их грозным предводителем. Этим геймплей игры и ограничивается – избиение злобных кунфуистов, а также существ, появившихся в результаты их неудачных экспериментов.

Street Rage – самая обыкновенная аркада, управление которой заточено всего под две кнопки. Подобных игр в 90-е годы было неимоверное множество. Street Rage старается копировать тот самый ретро-стиль, с выпуклым экраном и пиксельной, размытой графикой. Надо сказать, ей это вполне удается (в некоторых моментах, даже чересчур хорошо). Хорошо хоть разработчики не сделали игру черно-белой.

Adaptación videojueguil del corto que no hace tanto impactó en las redes sociales por su "lisérgico" argumento, en donde el protagonista luchaba contra facinerosos nazis, rodeado de referencias ochenteras, así como compañeros extraidos de la mente más drogada que hayas conocido.

El sistema de juego es el mismo que el del archiconocido "one finger death punch", o lo que es lo mismo, usando sólo los 2 botones del ratón, tienes diversión a mogollón.

22498015.review:
Kung Fury: Street Rage ist die Fortsetzung des Kurzfilms Kung Fury, der bei Release (zu Recht) einen riesigen Hype hatte. Entsprechenderweise sollte man den Film gesehen haben, bevor man es spielt. Grundsätzlich kommt man auch zurecht, ohne ihn vorher zu gucken, dann versteht man aber viele der Witze nicht. Das Spiel ist - wie auch schon der Film - gestaltet, als käme es direkt aus den 80er Jahren und vollkommen over the top gehalten. Vorab sei erwähnt, dass sich dieses Spiel mit nur zwei Knöpfen spielen lässt. Hört sich einfach an, ist es auch. Damit meine ich das Lernen der Mechanik... das Spiel an sich ist verdammt schwer. Es gibt mehrere Level mit unterschiedlich vielen Wellen an Gegnern, die es zu bekampfen gilt. Am Ende eines Levels gibt es immer einen Bosskampf und zwischen den Levels bzw. vor den Bosskämpfen wird die Story erzählt.


+ Eigene Story. Es wurde nicht die vom Film verwendet, sondern eine, die auf das Medium Spiel ausgelegt ist. Dieses Spiel als Film umzusetzen würde nicht funktionieren
+ Look (es ist alles sehr realistisch gehalten. Damit meine ich, dass es so aussieht, als wäre es tatsächlich schon einige Dekaden alt. Das ist den Machern auch beim Film schon wunderbar gelungen)
+ Musik (auch hier: alles sehr Oldschool und nostalgisch gehalten)
-> + Man kann zu verschiedenen Tracks spielen, wenn man im Menü auf den nächsten wartet
+ Der allgemeine Sound
+ Synchronisation
+ Humor (damit ist absolut alles gemeint. Es gibt kaum etwas, das in diesem Spiel nicht witzig (gemeint) ist)
+ Es gibt Anspielungen (wenige, dafür aber gut gelungene)
+ Vieles wurde dem Film entnommen, es gibt aber auch viele neue Sachen
+ Detailverliebtheit der Entwickler
+ Es spielt sich mit nur zwei Tasten
-> + Das führt dazu, dass man es praktisch sofort beherrscht
+ Es ist von Anfang an (trotz der mehr als simplen Steuerung) schwer
-> + Und wird mit der Zeit auch immer schwerer
-> -> + Sodass es vollkommenste Konzentration erfordert, nicht zu sterben. Vor allem zum Ende des Spiels hin
+ Es ist selten unfair
+ Man spielt nicht nur [spoiler]einen Charakter. Genau genommen spielt man in jedem Level einen anderen. Nachdem man alle Haupcharaktere durch hat, ist im letzten Level (wie auch im ersten) wieder Kung Fury an der Reihe[/spoiler]
-> + [spoiler]Jeder dieser Charaktere spielt sich komplett anders als die anderen[/spoiler]
+ Im letzten Level wird man gekonnt und auf lustige Art verarscht
+ Die Wellenübergänge sind fließend
+ Es ist sehr einzigartig. Grundsätzlich gibt es Spiele mit einer ähnlichen Mechanik etc., aber ein solches Zusammenspiel aus Humor, Sound, Gameplay und Schwierigkeit ist mir noch nicht untergekommen. Vor allem der Humor sticht da besonders heraus
+ Es versetzt einen direkt in die 80er zurück. Ein sehr nostalgisches Gefühl kommt beim Spielen auf
+ Spielspaß
-> + Motivation weiterzumachen
+ Es gibt einen Endlos-Modus, bei dem man [spoiler]sich jeweils einen der Charaktere aussuchen kann[/spoiler]
+ Die Bosskämpfe sind gut gelungen
-> + Vor allem der letzte
-> - Auch wenn es [spoiler](abgesehen vom letzten) immer nur derselbe mit leicht abgeänderten Attacken ist[/spoiler]

+- Kein Tutorial. Allerdings ist es auch nicht nötig
+- Kein Zwischenspeichern. Wird nicht jedem gefallen, aber gerade das macht die Schwierigkeit und den Reiz aus, es schaffen zu wollen
-> +- Frustrierend

- Keine Optionen
- Man kann nur mit Pfeiltasten spielen
- Der Mauszeiger bleibt immer im Bild
-> - Außerdem ist er unverändert. man hätte ihn wenigstens an das Spiel anpassen können
-> - Und er bringt nichts. Man kann nichts anklicken
- Es gab bei mir einen Bug, bei dem die Musik zweimal gleichzeitig, aber leicht verschoben lief
- Der Boss von [spoiler]Triceracop bzw. seine Stampfattacke[/spoiler] ist ziemlich unfair
- [spoiler]Hackerman. Ich hasse es, mit ihm zu spielen und vor allem der Boss war eine Qual[/spoiler]
- Es gibt nur [spoiler]5[/spoiler] Gegnertypen
-> + Diese reichen aber vollkommen aus
- Auch gibt es nur [spoiler]5[/spoiler] Level
-> + Aber auch diese reichen vollkommen aus, da sie verdammt schwer sind und man eine Weile daran sitzt


Für Fans des Films spreche ich hier eine eindeutige Kaufempfehlung aus. Es ist nicht teuer, macht aber unheimlich viel Spaß. Aber wenn ihr nicht gerne sterbt bzw. schnell ausrastet: seid gewarnt. Ihr werdet sterben. Oft.
Von mir gibt es eine Gesamtwertung von 9/10 Punkten.

21856458.review:
See also:  Five Finger Death Punch.  Similar style.
Two-button side-scrolling combat game here.  Press one button to attack an enemy on your left, press the other button to attack to the right.  That's it.  
Simple?  Yep.  
Easy?  Nope.
The whole point is to build up your combo attack chain as high as possible to get the high score and clear the level.  If you miss, your combo chain resets to zero AND you leave yourself open to an attack.  If you get hit, you lose health and your combo chain resets to zero.  You need Jedi-like reflexes to do well with this game.  I can't even get past the second set of levels (where you play as the bad-ass Viking babe).  You will automatically switch characters every few levels.  Each character has slightly different attack animations, but the gameplay remains the same throughout.
Character and level design are based on the short film "Kung Fury" which I highly suggest you watch.  You don't need to know the story to play this game, but the movie is a really funny spoof that pokes fun at everything from the 1980's.

21809479.review: So fun! Initially, I thought it would be just another Contra-like beat em' up, and the second I started to play and saw that was not the case, I thought I would get tired of it pretty quickly. Boy, was I wrong! This game is too fun!

21735274.review:
Ho-lee shit, how do you fuck up a two-finger fighting game? Kung Fury: Street Rage is a clone of One Finger Death Punch, with the trademark (and admittedly appealing) Kung Fury styling slapped on top. That's about all you really need to know about the game itself. I loved One Finger Death Punch, so why am I pissed off about this one?

The. Controls. Don't. Work. 

I know, that sounds fucking impossible in a game that uses two buttons, but they don't work! I just installed the game and I can only make Kung Fury attack to the right. I can also only go down in the menus, not up, and they don't wrap around. I've tried every key on my K70 and nothing works. 

What's that? Change the bindings at the options  screen? There isn't one! (There might be one hiding somewhere that you need an up arrow to get to, but the main menu has no options.) No graphics options, no control options, nothing. So for my money I basically have a two button game where only one button works. Amazing. Utterly astonishing. I'm a programmer by trade - how inept, lazy or non-existent does your QA team have to be that you can't get the left arrow key working in a game that only uses the arrow keys??

I Googled it, others were having the problem, and they were told to wait for a patch. That was nearly a year ago, and naturally the topic has now been locked because trying to get developer support for your games on Steam is like trying to fuck a spinning fan.

Fuck this game, go buy One Finger Death Punch. It appears to have far more content, and it actually bloody works.

21610543.review:
The positive reviews of the game before 2016 are no longer accurate, because it isn't the same game.  The original game was a beautiful classic, a perfectly oiled machine.  That game isn't available anymore.  The best way I could describe it is, originally you had a PC game, and they replaced it with a mobile port version of the game.  How else can you explain the game running worse than it used to?   And I'm not talking about fps, I mean the game feels inferior while playing it.

The character you control doesn't handle as well as it once did, the game is not as fluid and responsive as it once was.  The character's perfect responsiveness to your button pressing was the whole point, and that was ruined.  These issues were really really bad when their big update first arrived and people reported and a lot of people including myself noted that we were unable to achieve scores even a quarter as high as we usually did due to poor control responsiveness and other odd shifts to gameplay.  The developers have been slowly trying to fix these issues piecemeal, but so far I still don't feel they have managed to completly repair what they broke.

There were a lot of calls for bringing back the original game, at least as a classic mode.  I notice that those forum posts appear to all be gone, though I don't know if they were deleted or simply are no longer accessible from being a couple months old.  Needless to say, all cries for a classic mode were ignored, and the developer passed out some free keys to some smartphone port game in hopes of silencing things.

I paid money for a game and felt I had gotten more than my money's worth.  Then the developers took that game away and replaced it with something inferior, and while it's close, it's still deep in the uncanny valley.  I can't recommend to anyone what is still just a pale imitation of what was once here.

21261589.review: This game is very addictive. I played this, loved it, saw that it was a clone of One Finger Death Punch, bought and played that, came back to this shortly after. I found this much more satisfying. Much more satisfying death animations. It's more simplified but relies more on memorization of the different enemies than on reading their characteristics on the fly, allowing you to much better mix a large number of enemies into a single flow without taking damage, which is important since you can only take 2-3 hits before game over. If you think One Finger Death Punch is a little over-complicated at times, you'll find this one very addictive.

21260998.review:
I can't recommend this game when One Finger Death Punch exists in the same universe. It does nearly everything better (save story), but since gameplay is king, this just doesn't quite cut it.

The pacing is very slow at first, and since the punishment is harsh for failure (back to the start of the wave!) get ready to lose your traction a lot.

The 'hit zone' for where you won't miss isn't clearly marked, so you'll whiff until you decide to just punch enemies as soon as they touch you.

Got as far as the first boss battle, which suddenly and under duress introduces the new mechanic of movement, so suddenly that which caused failure (pressing buttons at the wrong time) is necessary to win. Muddied an already squishy gameflow.

Enemies also approach you in weird ways, so you end up missing sometimes when they decide to possibly change sides(?) behind you.  After getting to the Barbarian (Stage 2), and getting repeatedly disheartened by the pacing, quit and went to OFDP, and suddenly found everything that was missing in this game.

21070626.review:
Acheté pour essayer, je ne le regrette pas. Le gameplay est super simple (deux touches, ça pourrait se jouer sur une télécommande de TV) mais l'action est excellente et ne faiblie pas (au contraire).
Malgré la probable répétitivité des actions à faire, c'est très dynamique et varié car il faut enchainer les combos pour maximiser les points. L'action devient frénétique avec le nombre d'ennemi à l'écran et les effets visuels ou sonores.
Comme pour le film, chaque personnage à ses spécificités qui permet une bonne variété dans l'action et la difficulté.
Visuellement c'est dans la ligne droite du film avec des effets qui rappel immédiatement le temps des VHS et LaserDisc avec un gameplay digne des bornes arcades mangent-pièces à l'infini.

De quoi se faire une pause défouloir rapidement comme du temps des salles d'arcades.

Le tout pour un prix modique :)

20981573.review:
True honest: I bought this game only because it was very cheap (1.49E, I wouldn't had even considered it at full price...), and started with very low expectations (I didn't like the movie that much).

Despite the very simplistic gameplay, or perhaps because of it, this game is really challenging and fun: the graphic is nice, and though the whole thing is as dumb as expected, it's not as bad as I thought. 

One aspect that took me pleasurably aback, is how deep the combat system really is: I have unlocked only the first two chapters but it's already clear how the plainness of the first character's behavior is not shared by the second one (Barbarianna), where actual quick-timed planning is required!

This is the typical game you play just to pull the plug for a couple of minutes between more serious activities, and between how fun it is, and how little space it takes, I expect to keep it in my hard drive for quite some time.

Quite recommended for the price-tier.

PS: I found out a disturbing speed problem when played on my desktop (where it's very fast, and it's the "version" I have used for reference, and to beat the first stage) and on my laptop where is way slower. Not cool, but still a nice game.

20937227.review:
Il gioco è - a livello teorico - molto semplice; due pulsanti da premere (per attaccare a destra o a sinistra) seguendo un pattern che cambia in base al nemico che vi troverete davanti. Non c'è bisogno di camminare. Camminano gli altri. Voi li picchiate a sangue non appena arrivano a tiro. In realtà il gioco è molto difficile, perché i nemici arrivano a frotte e se perdete il conto dei colpi da dare rischiate di andare fuori tempo e di subire danni. I colpi che potete ricevere sono pochi (2, 3 o poco più, in base a quale dei 4 personaggi state utilizzando), nessun cuoricino che vi ristora la vita, nessuna pietà. Meglio non sbagliare.
Al momento [03/02/2016] c'è una breve modalità storia (piuttosto difficile) ed una endless mode in cui esercitarsi e battere i propri e altrui record di punteggio.
Se non l'avete già fatto (ma tanto l'avete fatto) vi consiglio di guardare prima il geniale[url=store.steampowered.com/app/374570/] cortometraggio [/url], in modo da meglio apprezzare i personaggi con cui vi apprestate a sterminare orde di nazisti muniti di pistole giocattolo e baffi quantomeno discutibili.

[u] Riassumendo [/u]:
[list]
     [*]gioco difficile ma estremamente appagante, una volta preso il ritmo
     [*]personaggi ripresi dal film (ciascuno ha arma e stile di combattimento personalizzato)
     [*]prezzo onestissimo per un gioco davvero ben fatto
     [*]always aim for the crotch
[/list]

20595851.review:
If you're a button masher... this game is not for you.

With only two buttons - left attack and right attack - Kung Fury: Streets of Rage is easy to pick up but difficult to master. Timing is everything. Attack too early, and your character can lunge right into a punch or kick. If you panic and start button-mashing, this is exactly what will happen.

If you can keep your cool, you'll find the game a nice challenge. Each character plays differently, with a different amount of health and different style of attack to keep things interesting. Each character's story chapter starts off slow to give the you time to figure out how the character plays, but enemies get faster and more numerous with each wave. The difficulty curve is steep but not impossible, and just makes it all the more rewarding when you finally get to the level boss.

The graphics are nicely retro. The soundtrack is pure Eighties synth, which I enjoy but may not be to everyone's taste. Highly recommend this if you're a retro arcade fan or a fighting game fan.

Při jízdě na pláž se naši hrdinové z filmu Kung Fury dostali dovnitř herního automatu a cílem je dostat se z něj pryč. 
Tato hra má vše potřebné, 2 tlačítka na mačkání, 4 hratelné postavy, z nihž každá je unikátní, 5 příběhových úrovní, každá končící soubojem s bossem a tzv. nekonečný mód. 
V příběhovém módu, pokud překonáte jednu úroveň, můžete v budoucnu začít kteroukoliv již otevřenou. Při soubojích s bossy si zas poprvé vyskoušíte pohyb do stran bez toho, že byste na tu stranu (či opačnou stranu v případě některých postav) útočili. 
Když zemřete u bosse (arkády), tak nejedete celou úroveň znova, jen Arkádu.
V nekonečném módu si jednoduše vyberete postavu a jedete na SCORE ! Nejvyšší score se vám započte do tabulky výsledků. Lidé na fórech sdílejí print-screeny svých nejlepších výsledků, neboť arkádové mašiny nebyly spolu v 80. letech spojeny většinou. 
Nekonečný mód je původní hra před updatem Arkáda vrací úder, který přidal příběh, nové namluvení postav a nové postavy. Původně šlo hrát jen za Kung Furyho.

Hra to není špatná, když jste v náladě, nádherně si ji užijete. Doporučuji pro každé tlačítko použít jinou ruku. 
Nedá se ale hrát déle jak hodinu v kuse, dojdou mince.

20439432.review:
The biggest selling point here was my insane love for the film and characters. As stated in other reviews, this is a two-button game and not a beat-em-up. While I would have loved a beat-em-up, I quickly got into this style of play as I got used to the different attack patterns and started building up some epic looking combos to crazy 80's synth rock.

Each character controls a little differently in terms of movement and attack so it stays interesting and doesn't feel like you're just trading out one character skin for another.

Kung Fury: press button, hit Nazi

Hackerman: never moves from center screen, builds up hack ability with four hits to enable hacking gun. Kills Nazis and Lamestash in one shot, King Fu Woman and Fu-bot in two, and King Fu Master in three.

Barbariana: four-hit combo that progresses from battle axe to two strikes with a chain gun with the fourth hit turning her golden, enabling the next attack with the chain gun to clear all enemies on one side of the screen instantly.

Triceracop: fires an assortment of guns, dodges backwards when attacking. Allows for good enemy kiting when timed right, keeping enemies on one side of the screen.

Kung Fury: Street Rage is good for a laugh and an excellent test if you're into highscore challenges. I just wish it had more dinosaurs.

20392595.review:
One Sentence Review:  Hey look, someone made a bad rip off of a Silver Dollar Game.

Three Sentence Review:  One Finger Death Punch is an excellent game.  You should buy that instead.  It has better mechanics and less bugs.

More In-Depth Review

Take One-Finger Death Punch.  Now remove about 75% of it, and replace stick-men with sprites that have 3-4 attacks in total each.  What you've got left is Kung Fury: Street Rage.  It's not even really graphically superior because of that broken old arcade-machine look they implemented, which gives me more eyestrain than nostalgia.

One Finger Death Punch lets you configure your fighter by selecting 3 skills from a large selection and they all impact the game significantly.  There are also a variety of enemies with different abilities.

Kung Fury: Street Rage has 4 characters.  One standard (no abilities but is the best because said abilities are janky), and then three others with two things that set them apart.  So already a lot less selection than OFDP in terms of variety.  For the most part, you're going to want to stick with the standard as the other three have either crippled health, mechanics that can throw off your rhythm, or both.  Your enemy selection is down to 5 types - standard 1 hit, standard 2 hit, 3-hit dodger, stanard 4 hit, and one guy that takes 5 with a different pattern.  Compare to OFDP which also has a 4-hit dodger, 4 hit standard, brawler, type-switching boss, wackloads of special moves, and a  variety of distinct styles of play.

OFDP has helpful guides and information on its screen.  Kung Fury does not.

OFDP has some really nice musical tracks.  Kung Fury does not.

The only thing that Kung Fury has that OFDP doesn't is a unique boss mode, and that's implemented so poorly it's not a positive thing.  While the core of OFDP is about elminiating positioning and button mashing in favour of precise timing, the boss mode suddenly has you moving about and mashing buttons to survive... but the collisions aren't handled well at all (which is terrible considering the whole 2-button game play is about precision) and the last boss fight was prone to bugging out.

All this could be forgiven if it weren't for the fact that OFDP is already a bargain at full price and offers a lot more game.  By itself it isn't terrible, but considering there's already a game out there that does everything this one except it does it better, bigger and came out first... just get OFDP.  Street Rage won't offer any new experiences.

20279834.review:
游戏体验看玩家一片好评就不必多说了，写在这里的主要内容是讲一下黑客男的操作方法。
对于喜爱这款游戏的新手玩家是很有必要的，不然也许就真的像我一样差点就放弃游戏了。

昨天晚上在绝望中说玩最后一把，结果就搞清楚黑客男怎么用了。

女武神是数12345（即5次攻击），第五次攻击就会清掉一侧的全部敌人，黑客男也是类似道理。
黑客男会hack敌人（可以理解成充能攻击或者换弹夹），这个过程恰恰也是12345，也就是说前4下操作，黑客男都不会发射子弹，只是在扫描（击退）敌人，当到了第5次操作，就会hack条满，并且发射子弹了，杀伤距离是全屏！！！可以杀伤屏幕内任何单个敌人，在hack条缓退为0之前可以随意连发子弹，并且击中敌人会涨hack条。对敌人的伤害很大，普通生化纳粹兵和金发男都是一枪秒杀，对金发女和机器人是两枪杀掉，功夫大师还没遇见，估计是3枪吧。屏幕内没有任何敌人时，或者一屏敌人已被杀光时，点击操作就会造成MISS。MISS硬直特别大，只要MISS了，就基本上是死定了。
这就解释了为何我在打金发女时特别容易MISS挂掉，原理是当单个金发女出现时，你需要左右左右扫描她4次，到了第5次发射子弹击中她，第6次发射子弹才能击杀她。也就是说必须左右左右左右共操作6次。不论她刚出现的位置，哪怕是在屏幕边缘，你扫描到她第一次，她都会瞬移在你身边，所以一旦你扫描到她，你就必须左右左右左右连续操作6次才是最安全的，否则极有可能发生MISS。

说实话这游戏操作简单，但节奏感确实丰富多彩，我是先认识了游戏，才回头补电影原作的，却感觉游戏比原电影本身更加精彩，更令我兴奋。4个角色，每个人打法节奏都符合原电影的设定和感觉，先玩游戏是感觉好玩，看过原电影后再玩则更有代入感，总之，实在是太棒了。

20234418.review:
Öncelikle bu oyun Kung Fury Movie filmin'den sonra çıkmış bir oyundur; o yüzden önce filmini izlemenizi tavsiye ederim. (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bS5P_LAqiVg) 

Eğer yaşınız 30 ve üstü ise filme bayılacağınızı biliyorum, yok altında ise önemli değil yine de sevebilirsiniz ama bazı esprileri kaçırabilirsiniz ya da anlamsız gelebilir.

Filmi 2-3 defa izledikten sonra nerede bunun devamı derseniz henüz öyle birşey yok, o yüzden oyunu ile özlem gidermek zorunda kalacaksınız.

Oyun ilk çıktığında tek karakter vardı ve herhangi bir hikaye modu falan yoktu, o zamandan beri zaman zaman canım sıkıldıkça açıp oynadım. Şu an 4 farklı karakter ve hikaye modu da geldi, Her karakterin farklı saldırı özellikleri var değişik olmuş.

Oyunu oynaması çok basit sadece sol ve sağ tıkla oynuyorsunuz, yani soldan adamlar yaklaşınca sol click, sağdan adam yaklaşınca sağ click yapıyorsunuz, gayet basit görünüyor değil mi ?

Ama işin aslı öyle değil :) Şimdi bazı ipuçları vereceğim:

1- öncelikle sadece mouse ile oynamak zorunda değilsiniz; yön tuşları ile (sol-sağ) ve wasd (A-D) tuşları ile de oynayabilirsiniz. (ben sol el orta parmağım A tuşunda, sağ el yüzük parmağım Sağ ok tuşunda oynuyorum, en rahat bu pozisyonu buldum, siz de en rahat nasılsanız öyle oynamaya çalışın, çünkü bir süre sonra gerçekten yoruluyorsunuz.) 

2- Düşmanlarınızı tanıyın:

+Siyah Askerler: Bunlar tek vuruşta ölüyor

+Siyah Kadın Askerler: Bunlar 2 vuruşta ölüyor

+Beyaz Kadın Askerler: Bunlar 3 vuruşta ölüyorlar ama şu şekilde: soldan geliyorlar ise Sol-Sağ-Sol, sağdan geliyorlar ise Sağ-Sol-Sağ vurmanız lazım, yani ilk vurduğunuzda sizin arkanıza geçiyorlar ve bunu 2 kere yapıyorlar. 

+Gri Robotlar: Bunlar art arda 4 vuruşlta ölüyor

+Kırmızı Ninjalar: Bunlar 5 vuruşta ölüyorlar ama Beyaz Kadın askerler gibi biraz karışıklar 1-2 ,1-2, 1 şeklinde vurmanız lazım: Soldan gelene göre şöyle tarif edeyim: Sol-Sağ vurduğunuz zaman sizden uzaklaşıyor, tekrar yakaşınca tekrar Sol-Sağ, yine uzaklaşıyor ve enson Sol vuruş ile işini bitiriyoruz.

Bütün düşmanlar bunlar, şimdilik tabi ki ilerde yeni düşmanlar ekleyebilirler.

3- Dövüştükçe ekranın sol tarafında combo sayınız, sağ tarafında ise öldürdüğünüz düşman sayıları görünecek, İşin püf noktası mümkün olduğunca kesintisiz combo yapmak.

4- Combolarınız 2 şekilde bozuluyor, birincisi düşman yanınıza yaklaşmadan erken yumruk atmak, o zaman boşa düşüyorsunuz ve combo sayınızın çarpanı yarılanıyor. ikincisi düşmanın size vurması, bu durumda da combo sayınızın çarpanı azalıyor ama boşa yumruk attığınız zamanki kadar değil; yani boşa yumruk sallamaktansa, dayak yemek daha iyi :)

5- Hikaye yönünden çok bir beklentiniz olmasın, sadece endless yani puan kasma bölümüyle arkadaşlarınızla yarışmak çok zevkli.

6- Oyun telefonda da Android ve İos platformunda var; tuvalette oynaması çok zevkli :)

Filmini gerçekten beğendiyseniz oyununu da beğeneceksiniz, dediğim gibi herkese hitap eden bir oyun değil ama sevince de bırakamıyorsunuz; eski tarz oyunculara hitap eden bir oyun, parasını kesinlikle hakeden bir oyun.

20204901.review:
Kung Fury:  Street Rage is a throwback to the late 80s.  A two button arcade beat em'up complete with its very own unique soundtrack that would fit right in with that era.  The game has two modes:  Endless and Storyline.  Endless allows you to pick any of the playable characters and go into a series of wave after wave of mobs against you until you die.  Storyline has a little more meat to it with a certain number of waves needed to be completed before facing off against the end boss of that stage.  It also only allows you to play the character for that particular chapter in the storyline. 
  
I recommend this game to anyone that likes a good action arcade style game.  At times I almost felt like I needed to slide another quarter into a slot when I died.  However, the gameplay can become repititive and I recommend playing this game in short bursts.  In the end, the game is definitely worth the price and an immediate pickup if discounted.  
  
Here is some gameplay and the trailer to the HD movie associated to the game.  Have a great day! :)


http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=590446382

20080728.review:
Купил игру под впечатлением от одноименного короткометражного фильма. Решил, что раз с такой любовью и профессионализмом сделали отличный фильм, то и игра должна быть на уровне. Не ошибся! Но постараюсь коротко изложить впечатлиния в плюсах и минусах.

Плюсы:
+ Стильная графика - это не новомодный пикселарт, а качественная стилизация под игровой автомат.
+ Атмосферная электронная музыка - идеально вписывается в игровой процес. Если вы застряли на одном уровне и она стала вам надоедать, выходите в меню и начинайте уровень заново. Трек сменится.
+ 4 Героя с уникальными стилями боя.
+ 5 видов противников с различной живучестью и поведением во время боя.
+ Тактичный двухкнопочный геймплей - вот уж не думал, что в двухкнопочной игре нужно полагаться не только на скорость реакции, но и продумывать тактику. Особенно это заметно при игре за Барбариану.

Минусы:
- Сложность - я понимаю, что Endless создан, чтобы набивать больше очков и соревноваться с друзьями. Но вот для Story можно было бы сделать и упрощенный режим. Я потратил 5.4 часа на то, чтобы пройти 4 уровня и теперь с ужасом смотрю на последний 5-й.
- Увлекательность - казалось бы на сколько может вас хватить, чтобы долбить всего 2 кнопки. Но сам геймплей построен так, что когда видишь Game Over, то хочется сразу продолжить, поскольку кажется, что вот именно сейчас ты почти победил и твоя смерть просто какая-то нелепая случайность.

Одним словом рекомендую сначала посмотреть короткометражку и, если вас зацепит, то смело покупайте игру. Особенно если есть скидка.

20049451.review:
"I'm the viking with the gatling gun!"

Kung Fury: Street Rage è un picchiaduro a scorrimento orizzontale beat-em' up vecchio stile ispirato ai vecchi cabinati arcade degli anni 80. Il gioco si basa sul semplice utilizzo di due tasti: A e D. O freccia sinistra e destra, se preferite. Questo è stato il primo e per ora anche l'unico gioco che io abbia mai giocato in questo stile, e francamente la prima volta che ci avevo giocato mi aveva deluso abbastanza, non perchè fosse fatto male, no di certo, ma per la scarsità di contenuti. 

L' unica cosa che il gioco proponeva era una ENDLESS-MODE con classifiche offline. Basta, niente di più.

Ora, con l'update gratuito "The Arcade Strikes Back" posso dire che si sono tirati per più della metà fuori dalla tomba nella quale la casa di produzione si era ficcata.
Una modalità storia, addirittura! Spettacolare! Non potevo chiedere di meglio per un gioco come questo! Non dimentichiamo poi i Laser-Raptors! E la nuova possibilità di giocare con i personaggi del cortometraggio è veramente fantastica! Hackerman, Triceracop, Barbarianna: non posso desiderare altro (magari quale update farebbe piacere, ma mi sa che non ne vedremo altri).

Unica pecca è che la classifica della ENDLESS-MODE che continua ad essere solamente ed unicamente offline. 

Questo è un gioco particolare, e non a tutti può interessare: consigliabile per qualche euro se volete un giochino sul quale spenderci qualche minuto, oretta, non di più.

O jogo é extremamente simples: você só utiliza dois botões, um para atacar para a direita e outro para a esquerda. Seu personagem se move apenas durante o combo ou se errar o golpe.

O jogo poderia ganhar MUITO se fosse no estilo dos antigos arcades, com o personagem se movendo pelo cenário e dando porrada em todo mundo. 

Além disso, ao menos por enquanto o jogo está sem suporte algum para controles, forçando o jogador a desconectar qualquer controle que esteja ligado ao PC para poder jogá-lo. Caso contrário, o personagem só atacará para a direita.

[b]PORÉM[/b], essas falhas podem muito bem ser relevadas. O jogo é engraçado, a trilha sonora é boa e o visual remete ao filme. E além disso tudo, é barato. Vale a diversão.

19626056.review:
Y'know what?  This is fun.

Kung Fury did what it set out to do pretty handily and that was to spoof over-the-top 80's action movies.  And they made it free to watch!  So what more can you do to support these people?  Why not throw a couple dollars their way and get this cool 80's coin-op spoof as an added bonus.

On the surface, the sprites, backgrounds, and effects are spot-on, easily taking me back to Battletoads or Double Dragon and things of the like.

The controls and gameplay are super simple and the action can get overwhelming.  I'm admittedly not that good, but the Hi-scores give me a solid challenge to constantly ram my face into like a brick wall.

Since I bought this game, they recently added three more playable characters, each with their own playstyle, and a story mode (complete with boss battles) with spoken dialogue that's every bit as humorously poorly delivered and written as the movie (and it seems like they retained their original voice actors, or at least really good sound-alikes).  Definitely good for a laugh.

If you enjoy admittedly stupid humor and/or pushing the limits against all odds for that high-scoring run, I'll highly suggest Kung Fury: Street Rage.

19429988.review: This game is based on one of the greatest non-serious movies I have ever seen and is also one of the greatest games I have ever played. Gameplay breaks down into two buttons; left mouse (or arrow) and right mouse (or arrow), even though it is so simplistic, the execution is perfect. All you are doing is killing Nazi's with your fists but it gets more complex as you play for example, the most common enemy is a Nazi wearing a gas mask, they die in one hit so they are easy to kill. Next up is a Nazi with blonde hair, they take two hits instead of one. After that you have Nazi women - and once they are in the mix, shit goes down - they take three hits to kill but, once you hit them they quickly teleport behind you meaning if you hit them from the right, they end up on your left ready to attack so, you must react quickly to hit them again by switching sides but, like I said before, they take three hits so, they will end up behind you again. After the women comes the Nazi Robots. They take four hits but, if you are not quick to destroy them, they will jump back and gang up with other enemies. There is no other strategy against them except to kill them as quickly as possible. The last enemy I have encountered is a Red Ninja and he is special because he is a robot and a woman combined meaning when you hit him, he will teleport behind you and on the second hit, he will jump back and gang up with other enemies.  The Red Ninja takes five hits and he kills me everytime I face him. In order to make this game more challenging, the developers added a health system for you, you have three hit points and no way to regenerate them (at least not from what I have seen). The entire point of this game is to get the highest score possible and it is a challenge to even get onto the leaderboard. If you like beat em ups with simple controls and want a challenge, buy this game now.

Antes de nada, precaución: aunque a simple vista pueda parecer un "beat'em up" al uso, como los "Final Fight", no lo es.
