18968284.review:
Kung Fury Street Rage ist ein Beat em´ up was man leicht versteht, aber nur schwer meistert.
Jedem dem das Spiel One Finger Death Punch bekannt ist, wird auch das Prinzip dieses Spiels bekannt sein. Für alle die es nicht wissen: Kung Fury Street Rage spielt sich wie alte Arcadeprügler, nur noch simpler. Mehr als zwei Tasten (links und rechts) braucht man nicht. Die Figur steht in der Mitte während von den Seiten Gegner angerannt kommen, die ihre jeweils eigene Schlagkombination brauchen um besiegt werden zu können. Man muss nicht laufen, man muss nicht springen, nur warten bis der Gegner in Reichweite ist und man mit der richtigen Kombination zuschlagen muss. Klingt simpel? Nicht wenn man bei jedem Fehlschlag (zu früh, zu spät, oder falsche Kombi) einen auf die Mütze kriegt und dabei bloß drei Treffer wegstecken kann. Zumal die Gegnerwellen sich nicht nur in der Anzahl, sondern auch in der schieren Masse an verschiedenen Kombinationen vermehren, die man alle so schnell wie möglich meistern muss, jeder kleine Fehler ist ein verschenktes Leben.
Optisch ist dem Spiel ein sehr überzeugender Retro-Arcadekonsolen-Look gelungen, welcher super zum Spiel passt. Das das Spiel auf dem bekannten 80´s Parodiekurzfilm "Kung Fury" basiert müsste eigentlich jedem klar sein, aber auch Leute die keine Fans des Films sind, werden Spaß an der Herausforderung haben, weil das Spiel keine Story erzählt, sondern nur Charaktere und Design übernimmt.

Fazit: Kung Fury Street Rage ist ein simples Konzept, welches schwer zu meistern ist und einen leicht süchtig danach machen kann es immer wieder und wieder zu versuchen einen neuen Highscore aufzustellen. Nicht nur für Fans des Films, oder 80-iger Arcadespielen 

Aktualisierung vom 14.12.2015:
Das neue Update ist da! Es ist groß und umfangreich...und schlecht für das Spiel.
Ja, auch ich hatte mir einen Storymodus gewünscht und schon mit dem Gedanken gespielt auch mal als einer von Kung Furys Buddys kämpfen zu können, aber jetzt wo es soweit ist wünschte ich alles wäre so geblieben wie vorher.

Ich habe, seit das Update rausgekommen ist, den Storymodus durchgespielt und alle Charaktere umfassend getestet. Das Problem ist nämlich das die Balance des Spiels durch die neuen Charaktere jetzt vollkommen im Arsch ist. 

Hackerman und Barbarianna sind vollkommen overpowered, sodass die Entwickler scheinbar das Gefühl hatten den Schwierigkeitsgrad zu erhöhen, blöd nur das das Spiel für Kenner jetzt mit den beiden oben genannten zu leicht und mit Kung Fury und Triceracop zu schwer ist. 

Alle Punkte die ich mir mit Kung Fury hart erarbeitet hatte kann ich nun nicht mal mehr erreichen und  falls jemand einen Beweis für die overpowereten Charaktere haben möchte ist hier ein Screenshot den ein guter Freund und ehemaliger Kung Fury-Rivale geschossen hat: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=572269282     http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=572270206 
Vorher haben wir uns gegenseitig immer dazu angetrieben den jeweils anderen zu übertrumpfen, aber das ist jetzt leider vorbei :(

Alles in allem bin ich enttäuscht von dem Update und muss meine Empfehlung jetzt für s erste zurückziehen, im Falle einer Verbesserung durch Patches komm ich nochmal darauf zurück und hoffentlich kann ich meinen Daumen dann wieder glücklich gen Himmel recken!

Aktualisierung vom 6.3.2016:
ENDLICH! Unser aller Gebete wurden erhört! Sie haben nicht nur die Balance zwischen den Charakteren wieder gebessert (womit die negative Wertung meinerseits ja bereits wegfällt :D) sondern dem Spiel auch noch ne flüssigere Performance und ne leicht bessere Optik spendiert. 
Alle Charaktere spielen sich jetzt so wie es vermutlich zu Anfang gedacht war und der Schwierigkeitsgrad scheint jeweils wieder angepasst worden zu sein. Wenn man es schafft Hackerman zu meistern ist er immer noch etwas overpowert, weshalb bei den Highscorejagden (meiner Meinung nach) die Spieler die es mit den anderen Charakteren schaffen umso mehr in der Lage sein können, stolz ihre Brust richtung 80´s anschwellen zu lassen!

Fazit: Kung Fury ist zurück und hat seine Freunde gleich mitgebracht! dank erneuerter Überarbeitung ist der Moment des Daumen-gen-Himmel-reckens endlich gekommen

18623488.review:
Одновременно с бесплатным фильмом Kung Fury с Steam была выпущена одноименная игра. Вернее это супер-олдскульная одноуровневая двух кнопочная мини-игра. Суть игры - нажимая всего 2 кнопки (влево и вправо), нужно отбить как можно больше врагов, совершая как можно больше чистых ударов, не промазывая, и не получая урона, чтобы получить как можно больше очков. Каждый промах понижает множитель очков, каждый пропущенный удар забирает 1 из 3 сердец жизни. После окончания игры смотрим таблицу рекордов, в которой могут быть ваши steam-друзья и вы (при должной сноровке).
Дополняет всю эту простоту приятный пиксельный вид экрана игрового автомата, олдскульный саунд и антураж в целом. + низкая стоимость.

UPD: С небольшим повышением стоимости игры разработчики выпустили большой апдейт. Теперь в игре 4 играбельных персонажа (сам Kung Fury, Трицеракоп, ходячий компьютер и девушка-варвар с пулемётом), все знакомы нам по фильму, отличаются они количеством жизней и механикой боя), усложненный режим выживания и сюжетный режим с боссами! Осталось добавить ачивки, кооператив и карточки! ^_^

Here is a mediocre game with very little apeal. Considering its catchy title, its based on a movie called "Kung Fury," which you're better off watching instead. See that here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bS5P_LAqiVg 

The graphics and music are very enjoyable and resemble a lot of cheesy 80s flare. The 1 downside that hurts the game's replay factor, is its controls. Enemies come at you from left and right. And you fight them by pushing the control stick towards them. You have no control over the moves you make and the enemies get rediculously harder in a very short amount of time. This all leads to a lot of cheap deaths and dozens of rage quits.

There isn't much to this game aside from an interesting premise leading up to believe that this game will be an beat 'em up. But when the game actually came out. We're given an awful stick fighter game.  Avoid this game at all costs. Just because its cheap on Steam, doesn't mean its worth it. You're better off playing better games that use their potential well, like Final Fight and Streets of Rage. Heck, watching the Kung Fury movie is bette than this. 2.5/10

17660351.review:
A game like Kung Fury: Street Rage, really doesn't need an overlong review. To start with, this is a two-button game. No I don't mean two buttons like Super Mario Brothers, I mean two buttons: left-attack and right-attack. Enemies approach from both sides, and all you have to do is press the corresponding button to kill them. Your goal? Get a high score. The average game of Kung Fury lasts a minute or two, and it requires only a few seconds to figure out how everything works.

But you want to know something? Despite it's simplistic nature, this is a pretty good game. Kung Fury is all about getting into [i]The Zone[/i] and establishing a rhythm. You know about the [i]The Zone[/i] right? It's that place you go to where you feel untouchable. It's like gliding in-between billions of bullets, shredding innumerable enemy forces, or in the case of this game, landing dozens if not hundreds of attacks with perfect accuracy at a rapid pace. This is a very focused game, so the simplest mistake is costly. You're only allowed three hits before death and each hit rips into your precious multiplier bonus. Worst of all, taking a hit pulls you out of [i]The Zone[/i]. You're about to high-five zen and then suddenly...back to reality...and reality sucks hard.

Since there are only two buttons, your efforts should be focused entirely on your enemies. There are multiple types, each requiring a certain number of attacks before they're killed. There aren't really any recovery frames, so you're free to hit the attack button as much as you want. Of course, if you miss an enemy, you're left wide open (this also depletes your multiplier). This is part of what being in [i]The Zone[/i] is all about. You're constantly judging the effective distance of your attacks, the type of enemy, and keeping a mental count of the # of hits/button-presses required to dispatch them. Sometimes it helps to memorize specific button combinations, so you can pull them off immediately on particular enemies. Whatever the cases, this entire process must be handled at a constant rate, and you're given micro-seconds to breathe.

In my experience, this isn't a game that lends itself well to extended play. I usually play Kung Fury until I best my high-score, then move on to another game. While it sounds sensible to keep playing to further improve on that score, it's more effective to quit while I'm ahead. Due to the design of the game, there's a high chance I'll press one too many buttons, or slightly mis-judge the distance of that one enemy, and lose. Repeated failures will lead to burnout. My advice is that once you get that great run, stop, do a little fist pump, then play something else. This is a game you'll want to keep around, even if it's just to get that jolt of action to start your day off right.

It's fair to say that Kung Fury: Street Rage lacks in content, especially compared to the similarly-designed One Finger Death Punch. What you get for your 1.99 is a well-crafted action game with nice aesthetics. This is a quick-fix piece of disposable entertainment, with its long-term value hidden in acquiring high scores as well as giving your gaming-ability a serious workout. It's an altogether solid tie-in with the short movie (which is also entertaining, aside from a weak 2nd act). 

Check it out sometime.

[i]If you liked this review or want to see more recommended games, be sure to follow our curator group: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/Original_Curators_Group#curation]Follow Original Curator Group[/url][/i]

17588642.review:
Edit: Free update invalidates any gripes I talk about in this review. I wholeheartedly recommend purchase of this game, the devs listened and expanded the gameplay and it is now SO worth the price.

My review marks this game as recommended, [strike]but there's a qualifier. It's only recommended if you want to support the fantastic people at Laser Unicorns who released an awesome free movie.[/strike] If you have not watched Kung Fury, go check it out.

Now, about this game...

[strike]I own One Finger Death Punch and the mechanics in this game are the same. Unfortunately, this game has many flaws compared to OFDP, but priced at 2$ and done in retro arcade style.[/strike] I know if I had seen this in an arcade I probably would have dumped 2$ into it and not been able to take the cabinet home. Having said that, quick list of pros and cons.

Pros
- Based on Kung Fury.
- Supports Laser Unicorns.
- Reasonably priced.
- Easy to learn.
- Good retro style graphics/music.

Cons
- No reach indicator. (No indicator at all when/if enemies are within range of attack)
[strike]- No consistency when hitting enemies (may hit other enemies if they move too close, messing up combos)[/strike]
[strike]- Too short of a "next attack" window (OFDP does this well, when you kill an enemy you have a brief slowdown to attack next enemy, KF:SR has little to no next attack window)[/strike]
[strike]- Flash on hit (distracting)[/strike]
- Multiplier based scoring, with punishing drops in multiplier for misses and taking damage.
[strike]- No variety, what you see on title screen is entirety of game.[/strike]

[strike]With those cons, the game doesn't amount to something I would recommend, but[/strike] at its price point and given that it supports Laser Unicorns, I do recommend it to anyone who really enjoyed the movie and would like to support the creators. [strike]Just don't expect a lot of fun in this title.[/strike]

17493775.review: Pure, unadulterated fun. Plain and simple. If you liked those old arcade machines that are now just grease-collectors at malls, and enjoyed how many times you'd play the same game over and over again because of it's addictive qualities, then Kung Fury is the game for you! It's violent, fast-paced, and fun! And the best part is you don't have to waste a quarter every time you want to play another round. My only complaint with the game was that as the game got harder, it became more frustrating to count my attacks (since that's one of the important features of this game), and the mobs would start grouping together and I'd have no clue how many hits it would take to kill them all. But, this is still a very fun little indie game that really recaptures the old, quaint, monotonous games that just made you say "One more round!". You can play this game with a few minutes before a date, or for a half-hour, because there's nothing to do. It's just a simple, fun game.

The movie is free, with that said buying the game like it or not is a great way to support that awesome sauce of a movie.  This game is NOT for everyone, many will find it boring, repetitive, tedious, which it is...  With that said the game truly is a martial arts kung fu game of discipline for those who want a challenge.  There is no changing backdrop or level and not many enemy types watcha see in the previews on the store page is watcha get.  Being that the game is cheap and movie free, buy the game for you, for friends, family, its a good gift because people like gifts, the game works and its repetitive but its fun even for a hot minute which is really all that matters.  

For those who accept the challenge to become a ninja, prepare to test those reflexes.  Gameplay is similar to one finger death punch where you only attack left and right.  Unlike OFDP, the player moves slightly meaning the attacks can be calculated by the player adding more strategery.  Also there is only attacking left and right, no special moves, nothing.  The goal is to get a high score.  Mastering this game is possible, the more its played the more discipline the player gets just like real kung fu the better they get at the game.  Try it out, when playing at first it feels boring, or annoying the score doesnt go up.  But just like Kung Fu the more its mastered, those scores keep going higher and HIGHER!  

Kung Fury Tips:
1.  Find the keyboard, mouse, or controller combo that works best for you.  Alot of keys, mouse buttons, and controller  functions all perform the attacks, find which are quickest for you to be a more effective super ninja.
2.  Count the number of hits diff enemies take, memorize their move pattern like the white nazis.
3.  Plan attacks ahead of time to keep track of hits in diff directions.
4.  Do NOT let the enemies clutter one side then you cant tell how many hits to throw.  Stay focused as a Ninja, know where the enemy is to strike at them with FURY!

(Buy this game to support the movie, who cares the price!)
Rating:  4/10  Value:  $1.99

17232666.review:
这是一个规则简单的游戏。
在简单的规则下却又千变万化。

电影中的人物在记分板上留下了阶梯式的得分目标。
使这款游戏的寿命更大的延续，但当你达到自己的目标后，这款游戏也就结束了。

游戏只有2个按键，在横版卷轴上操作人物左右攻击，就是如此简单。
但是，配合敌人不同的闪避方式，就出现了针对性的攻击方法，类似用2个按键来发的连招。
这2条规则就构成了，操作简单，但过程复杂的完整系统。

游戏虽然只有40MB的大小，但娱乐性强、打击感赞。
是不可多得的好游戏。

IOS上也有这款游戏，是免费游玩，付费去广告的收费方式。因此广告很频繁，价格和PC版相同1.99USD或12RMB。

设备推荐
PC版本可以使用：键盘、鼠标、手柄。等各种设备来玩。
因为只需要2个键。

单手我只推荐用鼠标。
因为鼠标按键反馈最快，键程最短。
其次鼠标使用食指和中指最为方便，惯用手上的这两个手指是日常电脑操作、游戏中用的最多的。
因此熟练度和反应速度都是最好的。

键盘（我使用的是樱桃无冲茶轴+原厂键帽）：虽然有多重键位选择，但是在两个按键之间必定隔了一个键。而且键盘的键程相比鼠标微动长了很多，击发速度也因此变慢。

手柄（我使用XBOX ONE 的手柄）：按键是薄膜结构，手感并不好，段落感强，键程也长，不推荐。至于摇杆，那是醉了。倒是RB、LB的按键不错，如果你习惯用两只手，我推荐用这两个键来玩。

更多游戏教程信息请去我的指南中查看：
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=490866724

Basically a one finger death punch clone. Although unlike OFDP there's only one endless mode in this game. Endless amounts of enemies keep coming at you and you have just 2 buttons as your disposal. Right clicks attack at the right side of the screen and left clicks attack at the left side of the screen. Wait for the enemies to come into "range" or you will miss and the enemies will have a chance to hit you. You get 3 lives, you get hit 3 times you die. Different enemy types take different amount of hits to kill. Some enemies teleport and you have to kill them strategically. 

This will give you nostalgia of Streets of rage like beat em up games even though the gameplay is totally different. The graphics and the art style is like those old school beat em up games. 

Soundtrack is neat.

Only $2, well worth the price.

17188658.review:
A lot of effort was taken by the Swedish developer to make a game that harken back to our arcade playing days, even capped by a 30 minute, super cheesy 80s inspired "movie" that accompanies this affair.  A fine presentation is there to entice you to believe this game is going to be an enjoyable experience, much like Far Cry Blood Dragon.  However, the movie and game starts out great but whimpers by the time I realized "oh, this has gone on too long".  A lot seem to enjoy the simple game play but it's too simple and forces the game to lack any depth whatsoever.  Too much time was spent on presentation with the lack of trying to make a decent game.  Instead of going with a tried and true formula, the game goes with a 2 button masher for moving left/right w/attacking at the same time.  Not sure why moving UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT plus 1 button attack and 1 button for jumping couldn't have been part of this game's equation.

I can't recommend this even at the cheap price.  Again, too much spent on presentation but there isn't much of a game worth playing here.  I would 99% never dismiss a game at this low price point but this game wasn't what I expected.  Hoping this review keeps anyone from making the same mistake.

I'm writing this review with my toes from my hospital bed. 

After watching Kung Fury, I decided to play the game. It was fantastic with a simple-to-learn and hard-to-master style of gaming. After spending way too much time playing this game, I had discovered that while I had broken the 2 million point barrier, I had also broken my hand and was controlling Kung fury with my mind powers. While I had experienced some discomfort after getting past Kung Fury's 250,000 points on the leaderboard, I then felt a minor tingling sensation and found that I had not only been bitten by a cobra but also struck by lightning after being shot in a pool of battery acid. I should have known not to play like that but I read on the internet that it would improve my game and as we all know: if it's written on the internet it must be true.

Doctors could have reattached my hand easily but I thought, "Why not go for cyborg hands?" So I did. I'm still learning how not to kill anything I hold with my new robo hand so I decided to type with my feet. 

Seriously, though, how do you not have a public leaderboard for a game like this?

16891452.review:
10/10 Would travel back to nazi germany again!

Game is very unforgiven, even more than One finger death punch, specially since you dont have the range indicators nor the patterns of the enemies, you have to learn them the first time you encounter them, and often die to them the first time.

Game is simple, left click = left attack, right click = right attack.
You get enemies coming to you from both sides, so you have to hit them when they are in range.
Controls are simple enough, but the game itself isnt.

Each enemy type has a combination to kill them. Some die in one hit, some in 2-3-4, some dodge and change sides so you have to attack the other side, but they dodge and change side again. If you have the patterns its easy to take them down, but when you have a crowd of different enemies closing on you from both sides, it gets messy and often times you will be 1 hit too short and get hitted or do 1 extra hit that will cause you to miss and not react in time from an incoming attack, or even you just were not quick enough to do your combo You can only screw 2 times, 3rd time is back to square 1.


Simple game. Fun game to kill time. its cheap and i can only recommend it.

graphics are fine, they fit the style. Soundtrack its 80's awesome.

Basically a one finger death punch clone. Although unlike OFDP there's only one endless mode in this game. Endless amounts of enemies keep coming at you and you have just 2 buttons as your disposal. Right clicks attack at the right side of the screen and left clicks attack at the left side of the screen. Wait for the enemies to come into "range" or you will miss and the enemies will have a chance to hit you. You get 3 lives, you get hit 3 times you die. Different enemy types take different amount of hits to kill. Some enemies teleport and you have to kill them strategically. 

This will give you nostalgia of Streets of rage like beat em up games even though the gameplay is totally different. The graphics and the art style is like those old school beat em up games. 

Soundtrack is neat.

Only $2, well worth the price.

16810304.review:
Kung Fury: Street Rage is an action game where you press two buttons to beat up Nazis. It's swimming in its own devotion to retro arcade games and neo-80's music, and it's hard as shit until you learn the difference between button mashing and deliberate quick yet precise button pressing. Once you figure out how to get on top of the leaderboards, that's pretty much where the game ends. You did it. You mashed your left and right keys into powder, kung-fu nerd. It's over.

It's two bucks. You probably already have that much from all your Steam Trading Card sales. If you like this and want more like it, check out a game called One Finger Death Punch. It's like this, but with tons more variation.

16767302.review:
Первоначально просто стильная версия одного из режимов игры "One Finger Death Punch", Kung Fury была очередным кратким напоминанием об эстетике игр 80-х, где не было прогрессии и достижений. Мы сражались только с рекордной таблицей, раз за разом пытаясь побить лучший результат. 
Расширенная версия игры принесла с собой целую кампанию с разными играбельными героями, что сделало игру более разнообразной, но удивительным образом не лишило её лаконичности.
В результате получилось хорошее развитие идей оригинальной OFDP, красиво офомленное, не перегруженное избыточными элементами и определённо очень аркадное по своему духу. 
Я бы потратил много жетонов на таком автомате.

GAMEPLAY:
The game is very simple as it only utilize left and right attack to punch, kick, or even shoot the never ending incoming hordes of Nazi’s soldier from, well, left and right side of the screen. You’ll try to beat your own score again and again until you stressed out or succeed to beat it.

GRAPHIC:
I can’t say much about the graphic as it looks old with an old tv screen effect (I like this) that resembling retro games. The attacks have some variation so people who play this game doesn’t get bored easily (I don’t care about the variation, but it’s a nice addition to the game).

AUDIO:
Like the music a lot and it is good (from my opinion), it always reminds me of 80’s or 90’s games. I Miss the sound of NES, SNES and Sega Mega Drive golden era.


LAST WORDS:
For a game at this price, it’s a lot of fun (for me at least) for killing your time. I would like to recommend this game who love retro game as the graphic resembling old tv screen.
And don’t forget to see the Kung Fury movie, I think the movie is a lot more expensive to produce rather than the game.

16749508.review:
Some people are complaining about the simplicity and repetitive ways of this game. You mean just like tetris, pacman and many many other games that opened the doors for whatever we have today? This is precisely what this game is, in my opinion, a door opener. 

Both the game and the movie are helping to light the path for the creative minds that do not have deep pockets but still want to bet in their creations and may or may not be afraid to poke their heads out to take the bullet. This game indeed does not have much content to offer, but I look at my purchase like an investment for possible future content to be created. Who knows? Other playable characters, new moves, game modes and, my personal favorite, another game in the future, classic side scrolling beat'em up where I may play as triceracop and shoot people in the balls and call Thor and his epic pecs to annihilate nazis as a special.

It's a cheap game that may give you quite some time of fun and that sends a message to the creators of Kung Fury and everyone behind the production of the movie and this game: Go ahead, brothers and sisters, keep on working, I'm interested in what you're creating, go ahead and give me more. Tank you!

Edit: I was right, bitches! New content has been added to the game. Keep buying, let these guys know you care <3

О да! Это наши, лехие 90! Мое детство. Все мы помним Кунг Фури, ещё смотрели его будучи совсем маленькими шпендиками. Оббирали своих мамаш, чтобы пойти в магазин Денди, ведь именно там, в подвале, стоял этот замечательный игровой автомат! Сколько жетонов, нервов и часов было потрачено, не счесть... (Кстати, одна такая старая кассета у меня так и лежит, пылится в коробке с видаком). Славные были времена всё-таки... Играли во дворе по ролям, каждый хотел быть Кунг Фури, но фашистами и Гитлером никто быть не хотел! (Но лично мне нравилась роль Барбарианы, не смотря на то, что я был пацаном. 10 из 10. Прослезился...

Por solo 2 dolares, tendras un juego arcade muy, pero MUY adictivo, una hora de juego se me paso como si nada, y ver que mis numeros aumentaban, me dan ganas de seguir para superarme. 

El menu de pausa es una recreacion de una "pantalla azul de la muerte", con el estilo de la vieja escuela. 16717100.review:
W dzisiejszych czasach gry przeganiają się ciągle. Każdy twórca chce w swoją grę wsadzić jak najwięcej wszystkiego. Tytuły, które dostajemy są przepakowane zawartością. Często omija się niektóre rzeczy, aby tylko domęczyć tytuł. Bywa i tak, że zwyczajnie odkładamy go na bok i nigdy do niego nie wracamy.

Aby jednak przyciągnąć gracza na dłużej, dołożono jeszcze więcej zawartości - osiągnięcia i karty Steam.

Wszystko ślepo pędzi przed siebie zapominająs skąd się wzięło i po co istnieje. I właśnie ty wkracza Kung Fury: Street Rage.

Wiem, że film odniósł sukces i większość osób ocenia go bardzo dobrze (98% z ~14000), ale nawet gdyby nie on, to gra i tak dałaby sobie radę. Pomimo tragicznej grafiki i zerowej fabuły oferuje coś o czym większość twórców dziś zapomina: grywalność. Innymi słowy: czystą przyjemność z gry. Grając można przypomnieć sobie pierwsze automaty. Znów poczuć się jak dziecko. Stylizacja na lata '80 jest bardzo dobra i wiarygodna, a dane do dyspozycji dwa przyciski zapewniają więcej czystej radości z gry niż niejeden Skyrim czy inny Wiedźmin z rozbudowanymi opcjami sterowania klawiaturą/padem, przełączaniem się między znakami itd...

Mówi się, że geniusz tkwi w prostocie i na tym przykładzie ewidentnie widać, że tak jest. To idealny przykład, że żadne karty czy inne osiągnięcia nie zastąpią zwyczajnie dobrej rozgrywki. Nie jest to tytuł, który nas umoralni, czy sprawi, że będziemy wrażliwsi. Jednak na 100% dostarczy dobrej zabawy.

[h1] Kung Fury - или шедевр за 60 рублей [/h1]

Итак, коротко об игре: мы играем за супер-мега-крутого кунг-фу бойца Кунг Фьюри. Суть игры проста - бить всех подряд. управление не замысловатое - всего две кнопки (стрелки вправо-влево), соответственно бить туда-сюда. Когда мы побеждаем одного из многочисленных противников нам дают множитель очков чтобы поднятся вверх по таблице рекордов. Если же противник побеждает вас, забрав 3 единицы жизни, вы умираете и появляется статистика. Сама игра закошена под игровой автомат [spoiler](который, слава богу не отправит вас нахуй как в фильме)[/spoiler], о чем символизирует  8-битная графика, 8-битная музыка и управление на 2-х кнопках. В общем, игра заслуживает своих 60 рублей, берите, не пожалеете)

16661029.review:
Like others have said, great game if you know what you're getting into.
Press left to attack to your left, press right to attack to your right. Your character will vary the type of attack delivered (seemingly at random) to an enemy to either side, as in One Finger Death Punch.
You score on a local-only leaderboard (not other online players), and your score will increase faster if you land every hit. 
If you're hit 3 times, you're defeated. 
It didn't hold my attention for long, but if you like the Kung Fury movie (and/or One Finger Death Punch) then it's easy to recommend this to you.

16635244.review:
First of all, if you have not yet seen the movie "Kung Fury", do so (it's available on videostreaming sites).

Secondly, if you grew up in the late 80s, early 90s, or simply like retro games you will recognize the look of the game.

Ok.. Review..

This game is simple, complex, challenging and addictive. It's simple because you only have two buttons, "attack left" and "attack right". It's complex because different enemies will take different combinations using those two buttons to kill. It's challenging because the different types of enemies will swarm you at an increasing speed. It's addictive because you'll keep trying to beat your highscore or those of your friends.

If you liked the movie, if you like the retro style of the game and if you don't mind spending the price of peeing in a public restroom on a game you might like this.

You have seen the movie, right? Right.

Sin duda, el famoso corto cinematográfico de lanzamiento fue un tremendo gancho, pero una vez que lo pruebas, no te quieres ir. Una oda a la simpleza, un golpe de Kung Fu a las grandes empresas que gastan miles de dólares en gráficos para sacar juegos que entretienen a ratos. Kung Fury te divierte con un gameplay abismalmente sencillo de dos teclas (left y right), una música vintage totalmente ochentera, con un héroe igualmente ochentero, parecido a Charlie Sheen en "Hot Shots", sus compañeros de equipo, todos deferentes en estilo y gameplay, y una marcada ambientación ochentera, simulando una pantalla de arcade de píxeles gigantes e imagen curva, con "Insert Coin" al centro. 

Por si fuera poco, el juego es simple, pero muy vertiginoso. Los enemigos no paran de venir y a ratos lo único que vez es "Pow!, Zap!, Wack!" de los golpes. El ritmo que debes llevar es sin duda un training para el cerebro, para acallar a los ignorantes que dicen que los juegos atrofian la mente. Te entretendrás y además serás más rápido de neuronas. ¿Qué más puedes pedir por 2 dólares?

Sin embargo, las opciones gráficas son... ES BROMA!!! Es llegar y jugarlo, sin opciones de configuración de ningún tipo, corre en cualquier water y como es vintage corre liviano y se ve siempre igual.

Elige entre el modo historia y modo endless, elige un personaje y comienza a descifrar su ritmo de juego. Todos son diferentes, así que no te confies en un patrón aprendido para un enemigo. Deberás enfrentarlo de diferentes formas según tu héroe seleccionado. Sigue la historia para encontrar divertidas frases y alusiones a otros juegos.

Por su relación precio/calidad, un juego simplemente fantástico. Nuevamente me rindo a los pies de los desarrolladores independientes, que con poco hacen maravillas. 

Tenga este juego. El gasto es tan pequeño en comparación a la diversión que entrega, que jamás se arrepentirá.

16606069.review:
This is a neat little title that pays tribute to the film of the same name, as well as 80's arcade games in general. 

Its a painfully simple game but hard to master. You have two attacks - left and right. That's it. No movement, no special power ups. Just manage your attacks as best you can until your three lives run out, and hope you can make a dent on the High Score list.

The aesthetic is awesome - the game plays as if it were on an older arcade cabinet, complete with scanlines and slowdown. The music is nothing too great, but they did include a 16-bit version of one of the songs from the movie (the game's trailer plays it about 12 seconds in - its a good track!)

There's not much else here. Sadly its a shallow game at its core, but overall its a fun time-waster that will push you to reach first place, which is no easy feat. A great homage to games of past, and definitely a great way to spend a couple of bucks to support those who graced us with the Kung Fury movie.

Here's to hoping for more games in the Kung Fury series. Well, I need to head back to the office. Looks like it's gonna be a hell of a lot of paperwork.

This is a very simple two button beat-em-up with retro graphics.  Basic gameplay is very similar to One-Finger Death Punch, but where that game is more fleshed out (multiple levels, unlockable abilities, etc), this game is just a single infinite-brawler level where you go for a high score.  I've found this game's main advantage to be that it starts up and shuts down very fast, making it good for playing in short bursts.

On one hand, I agree with those who say this game is the quality of a free Flash game.  On the other hand, it's $2 that support the people who released the awesome "Kung Fury" movie for free.

This game really goes to show that, at times, simplicity is all you need.

Pros:
+Feels like an arcade game
+Great graphics

Итак, геймплей - вы, Кунг-Фьюри, полицейский, который получил суперспособность быть.. (крутым?) суперспособным к кунг-фу мастерству на таком уровне, где зашкал настолько большой, что пока я пишу этот обзор, он уже отмудoхал 57 нацистов только одним свои бедром, совмещая происходящее флиртом с воительницей викингов.
Если у вас есть 59р! и 2 кнопки на клавиатуре <- и -> , то вы можете купить ее и начать свое Кунг-Фью-Чение в это безумном нацистско-пиксельном мире, где Тора ласково зовут Тортик, но вы никогда об этом не узнаете.
Вы не можете даже двигать в игре без взмаха конечностью - настолько вы крутой. А как же Кунг-Фьюри тянется за туалетной бумагой, когда похезал? Пробивает кулаком с размаха стену, падая с толчка, обoсрaвши ковер и забрызгав коричневеньким толкан. 
Однозначно, надо брать! Иначе вы не поймете ничего! 
Честно говоря, я многое понял, чего не был в фильме! Разработчики настолько сильно связали игру с фильмом, что я офигел! Вот слышали про секс? Так вот, это еще ближе чем пекес! Чем секес-пекес! ПЕКЕС! СЕКЕС! ШМЕКЕС!

10 усов Кунг-Фюрера из 10

Das Spiel ist extrem simpel, es gibt nur 2 Knöpfe. ABER das heißt nicht, dass es nicht fordernd ist. Es gilt das Prinzip "Leicht zu erlernen, schwierig zu meistern". Wenn man wirklich den Highscore knacken will, ist das Spiel richtige Arbeit. Man muss sich extrem konzentrieren um die verschiedenen Gegnertypen richtig anzugreifen. Wenn man bei höheren Punktzahlen auch nur einmal daneben schlägt, endet das meist sofort mit einem Treffer und eure gesamten Kombopunkte sind weg. Wer was witziges für Zwischendurch sucht, ist hier an der richtigen Adresse. Mal davon abgesehen dass es fast geschenkt ist. 
Falls ihr den gleichnamigen Film noch nicht gesehen habt: Unbedingt nachholen! Mit dem Streifen im Hinterkopf ist das Spiel auch gleich viel besser.

Edit: Nach einem Update gibt es nun insgesamt 4 Charaktere, die allesamt unterschiedliche Eigenschaften haben. Insgesamt sind diese für den Highscore-Modus aber gut gebalanced, finde ich. 
Außerdem ist ein Story-Modus dazugekommen, in dem man mit den 4 Helden (und Thor) die Welt vor bösen Nazi-Spielautomaten retten muss. Voll mit (im positivsten Sinne) schlechten One-Linern und jeder Menge spannender Storywendungen (nicht). Perfekt! 

Spätestens nach dem großen Patch auf jeden Fall einen Kauf Wert!

16324251.review:
This game is simple, awesome, fun, and dangerously addicting. There's literally two buttons, and those are used to attack on either side of you when enemies get in your range. The more attacks you do without missing or getting hit, the more delicious points you rack up. Simple stuff.

Except not really.

Enemies start off hilariously easy. You'll be punching through time travelling nazi skulls like cake at the beginning. Soon enough one punch won't take down certain enemies. Then certain enemies will teleport on the other side of you, so you'll need to respond with a sweet roundhouse, then punch them again when they teleport once more. Then you'll fight robots that take a ton of hits. Then you'll fight kung fu masters who teleport like four times! It just adds onto the insanity that is Kung Fury.

Soon enough you'll start being a kung fu master. You'll learn the combos to take down each enemy, executing them in half-second and you watch yourself tear through each enemy. You'll be so aware on what's on both sides of you you'll grow a third eye just to watch your character punch, kick, shoot, and deliver justice to each and every last enemy.

Once you take your three hits, you start over and try to beat your scores. I keep coming back for mor justice delivering each time. 

TL;DR: It's like One Finger Death Punch but with better style and a super rad soundtrack.

16301555.review:
[i]Kung Fury: Street Rage[/i] is essentially the core mechanics of [i]One Finger Death Punch[/i] wrapped in an 80s arcade skin. There is no tutorial, it simply drops you into the game and you are expected to learn as you play. Luckily, it's only two buttons (your mouse), so even if one has never played [i]OFDP[/i], it's extraordinarily simple to understand. Like its predecessor, [i]KF: SR[/i] is very easy to get, but difficult to master, and this provides a short game with a little more replayability, as well as the radical high score table.

Like the movie it's based on, [i]Kung Fury: Street Rage[/i] is short, but [i]so[/i] sweet. I very highly recommend it, even if you haven't played [i]One Finger Death Punch[/i]. [i]Especially[/i] if you haven't played [i]One Finger Death Punch.[/i] It's an arcade-sized romp that is too fun to pass up.

16291702.review:
As it doesn't look like some one's written an actual review for the game I'll take it upon myself to do exactly that.
As it's very much like One Finger Death Punch(OFDP) I'm going to be comparing them two a lot in this review.

Pro:
-OFDP but $3 cheaper (You could call this game a reskin of OFDP, but then you could call all games under this genre a reskin of OFDP)
-It's endless.
-Music is great

Con:
-There are no options. This wouldn't be a problem if it would allow me to mute the music without muting the whole game under volume mixer. Yes I did say the music is great, but I still would like to listen to some of my own music while playing this.
-The flow of the game isn't as good as OFDP. When ever you attack it sometimes feels like your character is frozen for a split second but the enemies can still move.(This might just be me from the conditioning OFDP has put into me)
-Less content than OFDP

If OFDP was a 10/10 (WHICH IT ISN'T) Kung Fury: Street Rage would be a good 7/10 compared to it. So take what you think of what you would rank OFDP and do the math I'm too lazy to tell you how to do.

If you are looking for a game like this I suggest getting OFDP over this. Only if you are going to put more than an hour or two into the game. If you're only planning on playing it a couple times a month at max I highly recommend you buy Kung Fury: Street Rage instead.

16286077.review:
EDIT 2015-12-07

With The Arcade Strikes Back edition, a story mode has been included featuring Hackerman, Barbarina and Triceracop as selectable characters. It is now insanely hilarious! I would now call this a more complete game compared to before. Is it worth full price? HELL YES! The developer really should be supported in this case. I mean they could have done something like many other publishers, like releasing the characters as separate purchaseable DLC, but they did not. So this game is a MUST BUY!

EDIT 2015-06-10

Like some others, I initially bought this game only to show my appreciation for the free and awesome movie. But man, if you haven't played a game of this genre/mechanics before you might be in for an @ss whopping surprise ... literally. In fact I counted my @ss being handed down to me over 650 times.

So you're playing on this street with Hitler's henchmen coming in at you left and right. You just so happen to have only two buttons to press to defend yourself ... left and right arrow keys. But there is an incredible amount of things to learn from button combo's to timing presses. So it goes something like this:

Gas Masked Soldier = 1 hit
Arian Moustache Guy = 2 hits
Shaolin Chick = 3 hits (left, right left OR right left right)
Mechanical Robot = 4 hits
Red Ninja = WTF??? Major distraction!

In essence the game overall is addictive. Even the music is as addictive as Hotline Miami's soundtrack. It's also great in the way that it's a game you can just load up and play with each round lasting (for me) about 2 mins and then exit it really quickly. It isn't feature rich like with options, but that isn't a problem imho. One of the best $2 I've spent.

Now I feel like I have to justify myself, this recommendation is a testimonial to say I must stop playing because it's addictive. It's important to make that distinction. I'm not playing for scores :D I never did. My highest personal expectations was left back from 40,000 to 70,000. Having said that I'd like to point to another recommendation: [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/saucex4/recommended/373180/]sauce recommends[/url]

16254345.review:
Kung Fury: Street Rage es un videojuego de estilo arcade en el que usamos solamente dos teclas -izquierda y derecha en el teclado; botón izquierdo y derecho en el mouse- para eliminar a diestra y siniestra, conectando puños, patadas y disparos (aleatorios), a lo que pareciera ser un sin fin de enemigos. Entre dichos enemigos se encuentran soldados del ejército de "Kung Fhürer", karatecas, ninjas y maquinas.

¿Nuestro objetivo? Conseguir la mayor puntuación posible para coronarnos con el primer puesto en el tablero. Esto puede ser posible solo si memorizamos la cantidad necesaria de golpes para eliminar a cada tipo de enemigo, al abatir seguidamente uno detrás del otro nuestro multiplicador por combos aumentara los puntos por cada personaje. La dificultad está en que tendremos que evitar a toda costa lanzar golpes al aire y/o ser atacados, ya que de esta manera disminuirá exageradamente el multiplicador de puntos. Basta con solo tres golpes para que hagan boleta a Kung Fury.

Lo Bueno:
- Adictivo
- Simple y divertido
- Gráficos excelentes

Lo Malo:
- Variedad de enemigos

Puntaje Final: 7,5/10

----------------------------------------------------

Kung Fury: Street Rage is an arcade style game where you use only two right -left keys on the keyboard; Mouse- left or right button and to remove left and right , connecting punches, kicks and shots ( random ) , what seems to be an endless amount of enemies. Among these enemies are soldiers of the army of "Kung Fhürer " karate , ninjas and machines.

Our objetive? Get the highest possible score for crown us with first place on the board. This can be possible only if we memorize the number of strokes needed to eliminate each type of enemy, then bring down one after the other combos increase our multiplier points for each character . The difficulty is that we must avoid at all costs throw punches the air and / or be hit because so exaggerated decrease the multiplier. Just only three strokes to make Kung Fury ballot .

The Good:
- Addictive
- Simple and fun
- Great graphics

The Bad:
- Variety of enemies


Final score : 7,5 / 10

Para ser sincero, jamas me interesaron los juegos en los que el unico objetivo final es el de superar el mas alto puntaje, o "High score". Este juego es la primer excepcion con la que me he cruzado. El juego es adictivo a mas no poder, ya que no solo buscas superar el puntaje mas alto registrado por defecto, sino a vos mismo, tratando de ver hasta donde llegan tus reflejos para reaccionar a tiempo, al atacar a decenas de enemigos a la vez, e intentando anticiparte a sus patrones de ataque. El juego ES dificil: No hay "continue", y apenas podes recibir 3 golpes antes de perder tu unica vida, pero asi y todo, te incentiva a seguir "metiendole fichas"
Tambien disfruto mucho de su estetica retro "ochentosa", y por si fuera poco, la exposicion prolongada al brillo de la pantalla comienza a lastimar los ojos, emulando perfectamente a las pantallas de tubo de aquellos tiempos.
De haberse programado realmente en los 80, creo que este juego seria hoy un clasico a la par de Pacman, Tetris, y otros.

En sintesis:
Si buscas un juego 2D casual, de accion frenetica, y que ponga a prueba tus reflejos, ESTE es el juego indicado.

16249489.review:
This game is like the movie it's based upon: more of a joke than a full-fledged piece of media, but surprisingly well thought-out in spite of its goofiness. It's basically a much simpler take on the same core concept that fuels One Finger Death Punch, but with excellent "bang for buck". It's particularly amazing how each subsequent enemy type adds a new dimension to the challenge and keeps it fresh. The result is an incredibly smooth learning curve that kept me coming back for hours.

Make no mistake: this game takes good reflexes, and in return it's utterly mindless. But that's a good thing sometimes. Street Rage is almost as good at turning my brain off as dish washing, but with much more ass kicking.

16249081.review: Entspricht so ziemlich seiner filmischen Vorlage: Toller Retro-Stil, klasse Soundtrack, aber inhaltlich naja. Erwartet habe ich hier ein Sidescroller-Beat'em up wie Streets of Rage, Final Fight, Double Dragon etc., tatsächlich beschränkt sich das Gameplay aber auf das drücken von ganzen zwei Tasten, nämlich links und rechts. Man muss praktisch einen so lange wie möglichen Combo hinlegen, und dazu im richtigen Moment nach links oder rechts drücken, so dass die Spielfigur die heranlaufenden Gegner verdrischt. Wenn man zu früh oder zu spät drückt, verfehlt man den Gegner, im besten Fall geht nur der Combo-Counter wieder runter, im schlechtesten haut dir der Gegner eins rein. Da diese anstürmen wie die Lemminge, und man nur drei Leben hat, ist hier schnell Game Over. Durchspielen im eigentlichen Sinne geht gar nicht, da es wohl unendlich Gegner gibt. Mehr als 15 Minuten hat mir das jedenfalls keinen Spaß gemacht. Zwar nur 1,99€, trotzdem habe ich dafür mehr erwartet.

16231416.review:
At first glance this game is deceptively simple, and even dumb; your only controls are a right attack and a left attack, and all you need to do is wait for an enemy to come close in that direction and press the corresponding key to hit them, The simple two-button design is a clear wink to the arcade games of old. But, like those old arcade games, this one has something intriguing that will make you come back again and again.

So, what is it that makes the game interesting? There is no real goal to reach in the actual gameplay, so the real thing to beat is the high scores list. Find the rhythm and you'll kick off The Hoff. Keep playing, and very soon, you will start getting increasingly aware of exactly which enemies are on either side of you, and even in what order, and you will start to memorize the exact combos to defeat each one. As the game progresses, it adds harder enemies with more interesting combos to beat, and you will get challenged to keep up that perfect combo without missing a single one, to retain that increasingly higher score for each kill. And that challenge is the true charm of this game.

Now excuse me, I need to beat Triceracop's score ;)

Игра - хрень на 5 минут. 
Управление вроде всего две кнопки, но при этом, движение персонажа совершенно не предсказуемые. К примеру, идет справа человек. Я жму правую кнопку, и почему-то получаю Miss. Постоянные Miss'ы. Т.к. других возможностей в управлении нет, то явно что-то не так с игрой. Не понятно, как бить и когда бить. Как делать разные приемы - тоже непонятно. Как пополнить жизни - не ясно. Я понимаю, что игра - имитация игрового автомата. Но даже на игровых автоматах была хоть какая-то краткая инструкция. А так - поклацал, получил постоянные Miss, через примерно минуту - меня убили. И так раз 5. После чего игру снес. Гемплея нет. Удовольствия от игры ни какого не получаешь. Не понимаю - почему и за что игру нахваливают. Если кто-то разобрался в управлении и как играть - пожалуйста, скажите. Пока оценка отрицательная.
Игру рекомендую к покупке тем, кто хочет поддержать создателей класной короткометражки, по мотивам которой сделана игра. Фильм супер. А игра буэ!

16221822.review:
For 2 bucks you really can't complain too much about something like this, a licenced retro version of 'One Finger Death Punch Lite'.  It's responsive and is fun although it also mimics the arcade feel by being completely unfair at times.  

Don't get me wrong, skill will carry you a long way in this but some of the things OFDP employed to keep itself fair have been omitted including the ability for enemies to group up in one space when one is stunned or sent flying (this happens a LOT with the Kung Fu master enemy who teleports away every two hits) which means that they often hide each other or cause you to strike one enemy pattern and hit another, sometimes this can even cause you to travel through them entirely which will usually cause you to break your combo when you miss and/or take a hit.  You also have no indication or feedback on if an enemy has been damaged at all, which is a problem in a game with only five enemy types in total and where you can knock them past others and even off screen.  Finally, if you get swamped by enemies that swap sides, the game will absolutely not let you spam your way out one side to get breathing room, sometimes giving you a miss despite the fact that there was an enemy so close your whiff passed through them, this can be played around but feels kind of arbitrary.

Also, you can't concentrate too hard as each time you strike an enemy, the screen will flash white.  This is a bizzare inclusion and could lead to players hurting their eyes or worse.  If you suffer from epilepsy in any form, I'm gonna have to recommend giving this one a big miss.

But hey, again, it's only 2 bucks and presents a theoretically unlimited challenge for those who love score attack games and/or just an all around nicer looking package for those who were put off by the overall better (and more expensive) OFDP's presentation.

16197154.review:
A fun little beat-em up dripping in nostalgia.  Take some 80s style arcade graphics, mix with  a less in-depth version of One Finger Death Punch and you've got yourself a fun little game that's well worth the extremely cheap asking price that's easy to sit down and play for 5 to 10 minutes at a time if you've only got a short while.

I do wish there was some progression like in OFDP where you could earn more skills or get some more kill animations, and my only big thing was that I wish Kung Fury's strike range was clearer.  I've taken a number a hits from misjudging how far he'll strike by just a little bit since you have to eyeball it, which can be hard when you're zipping back and forth knocking heads off of Nazis.

All that being said.. I've bought stuff out of vending machines more expensive than this game so you can get your money's worth in about 8 rounds if you use the old arcade standard.

16139854.review: Очень понравилось. Музыка и дизайн - ностальгия и не просто для галочки, а именно, то, что нужно. Вокруг экрана рамка, словно смотришь в экран старого телевизора, на самом деле игра и имитирует игровой автомат, с озвучанием опускания монетки при каждом старте. Две кнопки в использовании, но сколько комбинаций и удовольствия. Настоящий хардкор: три жизни (в виде сердечек) нулевой к сожалению нет)), нужно постоянно следить кого ты бьёшь и помнить сколько ударов приходится на каждого (несколько видов противников, с разным запасом здоровья), иначе промох, а это почти 100% гарантия потери жизни. Думал прошли времена извергского терзания джойстика, мокрого от пота и натянутых нервов. Нет! Вот чудо, дарящее былые ощущения. !Осторожно!: Возможно привыкание!

16135684.review:
Entertaining gameplay. "One Finger Death Punch" style: 1 button to attack on right, 1 button to attack on left. Some enemies takes more than a hit to be killed and you need to be synchronized to do combo chains. The game is very hard, you can only take 3 hits and enemies are fast and numerous.

Interesting layout: you fight nazis/kung-fu nazis/ kung-fu nazis robots and it's with an arcade machine style. The music is great.

The game has a short life span (1 endless mode) but frankly i'm glad to give my money for such an amazing movie.

Can't wait another one, closer to the movie !


N.B: Maybe they could have done something deeper/better. I hope they will do it next time !

16128824.review:
[h1]ВЫ МОЖЕТЕ ЕСТЬ ПЕЧЕНЬКИ И УСТРАИВАТЬ ФАРШ ИЗ ФАШИСТОВ ОДНОВРЕММЕННО ![/h1]
Kung Fury - это игра с прекрасным визуальным оформлением и звуковым сопровождением! Всё что нам нужно во время игры, так это выбрать - бить влево или же бить вправо. А, как известно, всё гениальное - просто! И это именно про Kung Fury. Набрав 100к очков (что достаточно сложно), это второе место на таблице лидеров, как я понял, среди друзей(и изначально заложенных рекордов), и поиграв полтора часа, могу добавить что, к сожалению, игра, помимо своего классного ретродизайна, унаследовала и ретропроблему.. Когда противников становится слишком много, то некоторые ваши удары просто игнорируются противниками, в результате чего происходит заминка, и если вы не успели ударить снова, то ударят вас. Этот недочёт осложняет восхождение в топы :( Всего за игру вы можете выдержать 3 удара, после чего можно начать сначала. Очень оригинальное меню паузы, меня, как техника, улыбнуло :) Рекомендую ли я эту игру? Да, конечно! Не смотря на то, что всего одна локация, примерно 5 анимаций удара, 5 видов противников(те, что я видел, возможно больше) и всего 2 кнопки для управления, игра полностью стоит своих 59 рублей и даже больше! А из-за её малого веса, всего 40 мегабайт, и непринуждённого геймплея вы сможете устроить [b]ураганный фарш[/b], который предлагает нам игра, в совершенно любом месте, где есть компьютер!

16126367.review:
[h1] Kung Fury Street Rage [/h1] é um jogo um pouco diferente do habitual, ele é um Beat ‘em up diferente. Aqui você só usa 2 botões ou mesmo o seu direcional, ao qual serve para bater para esquerda ou para a direita. Sua missão aqui é acabar com nazistas e acabar com o “kung Führer”. 

A temática do jogo é os anos 80’s, e conta com uma incrível trilha sonora da época, a sua visão será como se você estivesse jogando em um Arcade. Aqui você deve calcular o tempo certo para apertar os botões e fazer combos e mais combos. A única meta do jogo é bater seu próprio record. O jogo possui apenas um cenário e não possui “fase”.  Basicamente você vai matando nazistas, enfermeiras nazistas (lol?), robôs nazistas etc., até você morrer, e começar tudo de novo tentando bater o seu próprio record.

Quanto a história do jogo, bom... NÃO tem, o único jeito de você entender a história é vendo o filme no qual o jogo foi baseado (ou será que o filme foi baseado no jogo? lol)
http://store.steampowered.com/app/374570/?snr=1_5_1100__1100

O jogo é bem legal mais é aquele tipo do jogo apenas para se jogar de vez em quando, quando não se tem nada e absolutamente nada a se fazer mesmo, mesmo o jogo sendo bem legal eu não sei se compensa pagar R$ 4,29 nele, com certeza ele vale a pena, quando tiver aquela promoção do nosso amigo STEAM. 


[h1]Pros:[/h1]
- Trilha sonora estilo anos 80.
- Poder espancar nazistas até dizer chega.
- Precisa dizer algo mais? Espancar nazistas e robôs nazistas, o que pode ser melhor que isso?

[h1]Contras:[/h1]
- Curto demais, com certeza não será um dos seus games mais jogados.
- Basicamente um único background.

16119070.review:
Kung Fury Street Rage é um Game Estilo Beat'up misturado com a incrível jogabilidade de One Finger Death Punch onde você só aperta dois botões para o Personagem atacar e o resto, o Game cria.
Este game é completamente baseado num filme Gratuito (ou curta de Meia Hora) de acão/comédia, o Enredo é mais ou menos isso: Um policial que ganha Super Poderes que transforma ele num Mestre do Kung-Fu e usa isso para se tornar o Melhor Policial do Mundo mas Adolf Hitler decide voltar aos tempos atuais e dominar o Mundo e o Policial de Nome: Kung Fury, deve voltar no Tempo e matar o Antagonista. Simples não?
Bom, uma coisa que me agrada no Game é seu "Visual" e Tela de Fliperama. Cenários em Pixels como o Sangue, Personagens e Destruição. Agora os "Cons" do Game: Sistema de Luta não muito aprimorado; pois deveria ter mais conteúdo assim como o Filme, Power Ups no Cenário deveriam estar presentes e algum ponto de ajuda para facilitar as batalhas pois só temos TRÊS!!! Vidas. E também algo que indicasse o Range de K.F para atacar os inimigos.
Tirando e não se incomodando com estas coisas, vemos um jogo exemplar que fez combinações aceitaveis para ser um Game "Steam" e indo na "Onda" de One Finger Death Punch; o Sistema de High Scores é um ponto bem legal porque até os personagens do filme estão nele.
Kung Fury peca pela sua repetição e pouco conteúdo mas não peca nos pontos de Diversão.

16118843.review: I saw a Jacksepticeye's Let's Play and I thought it does not look like a bad game! Upon some pondering I decided to get it and for my 90 eurocents (the rest was covered by my Steam Wallet) I am quite satisfied! The experience is quite fluid from the start to the beginning - no annoying and endless company logos at the beginning, you can jump into the game with a simple click and get down to business - no tutorial, just "figure it out as you go" approach. I like that as this the game you want to play, when you have like a 5 minute break from something and get pumped by adrenaline-filled gameplay, groovy music, and satisfying visuals and sound. Yes, there is not much content and that is the biggest disadvantage as it leaves you hungry for more - more moves, more characters to play, more enemies, more backdrops etc. But...for 2 euros/dollars it is a steal, especially if you like the movie that is free... In a sense, you might see it as a tip for seeing the movie :)

16117479.review:
So everyone talks about the two right and left punches and how those are the only buttons and that's a really fun design. Here is how the game adds depth: As you can probably guess it does so first off buy increasing the number of enemies coming at you from right and left, second of all, there is quite a variety in enemy types; Some simply need one or two hits to take down; other are more complicated. There are enemies that doge around so you need to quickly press the right direction. Missing makes you vulnerable, you slide forward out of position for a moment as you recover, unable to attack. Some enemies are metal, taking a lot of hits forcing you to focus on them and the other one hitters simultaneously. These are just a few examples as the game does a nice job with variety and there are more types than just those I listed. That was the most surprising part for me. On top of the cool music, and combo tracker, there is only one mode (which makes sense), and nice retro feel (they nailed art style and the cool feel when you load up the game and the announcer goes: 'KUNG FURY!'). 
  You loose not because of BS but because you feel you really messed up on timing or because you panicked when seeing a tricky enemy combination and you spazzed out on the buttons, missing, and leaving yourself vulnerable. You have three hitpoints. I have not gotten far enough into the endless mode to see if you ever regain health. Lets find out together! Worth the price. Really fun and simple yet very deep game.

ADDED NOTE: The controls are basically hitting the arrows left or right or the keys (A,D), or the mouse keys. But you can combine to spread your hands out. Exampled: Use 'A' for left attack and use 'right arrow' for right attack. Which I like a lot

If you enjoyed "One Finger Death Punch" you will like this game. 
The presentation and overall impression is really well done. You feel like playing on an 80s arcade machine. Even the quitting menu looks like a BSOD (Blue Screen Of Death) and I very much appreciate this level of detail!. 

BUT unlike OFDP it gets a lot more confusing a lot faster. With time there are spawning so many enemies that are running up to you that your character gets kinda buried under all the kill animations and you loose track of him which in turn gets you hit.

I like the game though. In my opinion it's worth the money and at the same time you support the makers of the awesome movie. So it's a double win in my book but if you found OFDP already confusing and repetitive this game might not be for you.

Arcade-style beat-em-up where you smash nazis, robots, and other evil characters as an 80s kung fu cop.  Need I say more?  Worth the investment, especially if you enjoyed the Kung Fury movie.  

Pros:
- Great 80s soundtrack
- Great arcade/retro graphics
- Simple yet fun and potentially challenging (the goal is to achieve the highest score)
- Easy to pick up and play
- SMASH NAZIS

Cons:
- Highly repetitive
- Not much content, you just smash nazis until you die (you have 3 lives).  
- Game seems to have some performance issues with my Xbox 360 controller, game will lag/become unresponsive at times.
- No achievements or cards :(((

Overall worth the $2.  Recommended for anyone that wants a simple time waster.

16108175.review:
[b]Recommended:[/b] Kung Fury is the arcade brawler boiled to its base essentials, a cheap and short bit of fun - but fun is indeed the operative there.  Comparisons have been made to One Finger Death Punch, perhaps since it's the point of reference for this generation, but this is something most evocative of the dual button brawlers in arcade cabinets of old.  It's quick, stylish, and it knows exactly what it wants to be, and owns the hell out of it.

16103837.review:
Take a moment and mentally place yourself inside an old school arcade. You have 8 quarters (the 2 dollar pricetag) and you're going to go for a highscore. Once you've finished those 8 quarters, you'll feel fairly satisfied with the time you've spent (a few minutes) and you'll move on with your day. 

This is exactly the experience you'll get from this game. A few minutes of fun and you'll move on. The game is extremely retro and is really simple (left or right, thats it) but oddly addictive. I would say for the price it is worthwhile. This isn't a game you'll be playing terribly much, but again.. think of it like an old arcade and the price will make sense for the experience it will give you.

16102767.review:
Simple execution, excellent presentation, crazy satisfying.
Adding to the legacy of the beat-em-up genre of games, this one simplifies the concept of the button-masher even further, reducing commands to attacking left/right. 
There are various ways of input, either through controller or keyboard, and controls feel super-responsive! They did a great job here. What sold me on this one was how gameplay rewards quick decision-making, punishes redudant mashing of buttons and the beguiling depth in quickly assessing the opposition in terms of "how-many-hits-to-bring-em'-down", mixing it up and keeping it fresh with gradually introducing more advanced enemy-patterns as you reach for higher scores.

In short, bang for your buck (especially seeing it only costs you a wooden nickel). 
GIT EET NAO.

16099911.review:
Updated my review based on the new content and updates.

---------------------

Well lord and behold, this great fast paced arcade game got tons of new additions added to it. What was once just a simple survival score attack game, now has an arcade/story mode, and more playable characters! Either they had already planned to add more, or they listened to the fans and reviewers and gave us more, like playing as the other characters! Even getting the original actors is a huge bonus. Same great witty lines just like the movie.

I never even knew they did this till I felt like playing this game again and saw it with my own eyes. Once again I suck at this game, but had a BLAST playing this again. Still love that damn smexy soundtrack.

In Arcade Mode, you progress by completing waves of enemies to get to the boss fight. I was skeptic on how the bosses would work, but they worked out real good. Instead of being stuck where you could only attack and not move, you move by holding the buttons, which you need to dodge the boss attacks before he becomes vulnerable to you spamming the attack button to lower its health bar. Very cool. As you complete the section, you get to play as another character and do it all over again, but each character plays a little different, and the boss fight being different as well.

Kung Fury plays your normal press a button to use your amazing kung fu skills to obliterate your enemies. Can take 3 hits before you die.

Hackerman was the hardest for me, and could not pass his level in arcade mode. You have a "HACKING" bar you have to fill up by targeting enemies till it fills up, then you can blast everyone at a distance with his hack gun, which kills everything in 1 or 2 hits. Can only take 2 hits before you die.

Barbarianna is by far my favorite. She plays in a 5 hit combo style. Your first 4 hits are a melee and build up the combo, then your final 5 hit is the mini gun, which kills everything on which ever side of the screen you click on. Can only take 2 hits before you die.

Triceracop plays much like Kung Fury, minus the kung fu and uses guns to shoot the enemies in the groin, but has slightly more range, and a lot more health. Can take 5 hits before you die.


Some people claim that this got worse? They say that the controls are not as responsive as before, but honestly I didn't notice anything.



If this game wasn't a must buy before, it most definitely is now with the extra content, and for only $3! You can't go wrong with it.

What are you waiting for?! DO IT! DO IT NOW!


---------------------Original Review---------------------

I tried to beat Kung Fury's Highscore... Couldn't even make 4th.

If you enjoyed One Finger Death Punch and enjoyed the Kung Fury short movie, this is a great pick up! The game is a little lacking in content, and I do have a few wishes to be added into the future.

1. A character selection? Maybe let us play as the other characters that are standing in the back? It would be super cool to see different moves that the other characters could do.
2. Let us buy the Soundtrack? I want this soundtrack in my life.

Otherwise, fun game. I hope they improve on it and make it even better.

16099269.review:
Шикарная простенькая игра, выполненная в механике "One Finger Death Punch", обзавелась не только аж несколькими персонажами с абсолютно уникальными и интересными механиками игры, но даже целым режимом сюжета! Сейчас игра отбивает свою цену практически полностью, повеселившись и освоив персонажей в Бесконечном режиме, вы можете приступать к прохождению сюжета - или наоборот, сначала посмотреть новую забавную сюжетную линию, переполненную уморительными отсылками не только к фильмам 80-ых и 90-ых, но и к играм этого времени! Ну а потом - пойти бить рекорды в Бесконечный режим, определившись с любимым персонажем.
Однозначно стоит покупки - прекрасная возможность поблагодарить авторов фильма и прекрасный подарок за это в виде приятной и стилизованной аркадо-подобной игрушки.
[i]p.s. ну и справедливости ради стоит упомянуть, что в эту же игру вы можете абсолютно бесплатно сыграть на любом мобильном устройстве, скачав её в Play Market или AppStore. Только вот мобильные версии практически неиграбельны, по крайней мере на устройствах от iPod touch 5 и старее.[/i]

[h1]If you ever dreamed to be the greatest Kung Fu Master of all Time and beating up as many Nazis as you can, this is the game for you. Become Kung Fury![/h1]

[b]Developer: Hello There AB
Publisher: Hello There AB
Release Date: 28th May, 2015[/b]

Well, well, well ... I'm pretty sure you've heared about the phenomen which is Kung Fury by now ... If you haven't then I seriously don't know what's wrong with you.
The movie alone is a Masterpiece. We have to seriously thank each and every Backer for making the Movie possible.
Without the Movie we would have never gotten this beauty of a game.

[h1]Story ...?[/h1]
In Kung Fury: Street Rage you slip into the role of the chosen one Kung Fury. Your just doing your job: Beating up every Nazi Associate that runs into your fist or foot.

You'll encounter numerous Nazi Soldiers wearing Gas Maks (probably because of Swag), Gals infused with Kung Fu DNA, living Nazi Arcade Machines and Ninjas in order to stop the true Evil himself ... the Kung Führer!

Top Notch Graphics, an awesome Soundtrack and the Special Effect Sounds straight from the 80's accompany you on your beat'em up Quest.

[h1]Being Kung Fury isn't easy[/h1]
Not everyone can become Kung Fury. The controls in this game aren't easy to get into. Since the Nazis are coming at your from left and right at the same time, you'll have two buttons which you can press: Left Attack and Right Attack.
I told you the controls wouldn't be easy but hey being Kung Fury and beating up every Nazi in Nazi Germany isn't an easy job.

The game's quite short or long depending on your own Kung Fu knowledge.
You can take up to three hits before you're done.

I greatly enjoy the game and being Kung Fury and beating up Nazis is just an awesome thing.

[h1]What else can I say?[/h1]
Overall I can easily recommend this game to anyone and for just two bucks it's a steal.
The only thing we can hope for at this time is to get more content for this game ... but that depends if there are are enough left over Nazis.

I mean the Disclaimer says it all:

[h1]DISCLAIMER: 
*** NOT ENOUGH NAZIS WERE HARMED IN THE MAKING OF THIS GAME ***[/h1]

So I actually do have hopes for more content at some point.

[b]Buy the game. Show your Support. Be the chosen one. Be the Law. Be Kung Fury![/b]

16093438.review:
12/10 would try to feed quarters into my pc again.



**************


Serious Review:

This game plays basically like blind survival mode from One Finger Death Punch (OFDP). If you've played OFDP before then you'll know whether that was something you enjoyed or not.

If you haven't played OFDP, then the simpleist way to explain this game is that it consists of two parts... the main menu, and a score attack mode. There are a bunch of different controls available (a,d, left and right cursor, lmb, rmb and everything on a controller.. and that's just what I've tried!), but they all end up doing one of two things. Attack left, or attack right. You don't move in this game, you stand still and attack enemies when they enter your range. The attack range is never shown to the player so it's something that has to be learnt through trial and error.

Now that the gameplay is outta the way, I personally love everything about the feel of this game. The sprite animation is crisp, and is a joy to watch, the music is great. The sfx of the quarter being feed into an arcade machine at the start of each run as well as the way the window is shaped all add to the retro arcade machine vibe. Biggest problem I have is that every time an attack connects the screen does a yellowish-white flash which can get a bit irritating at times.

TLDR: A crisp game, that'll be great if you enjoy score attacks, or survival modes. But don't be expecting any story or upgrades/collectibles.

16088901.review:
Loved this.  Surprisingly highly addictive trying to beat my record and master it as it speeds up.  

What did I like about this?  Firstly, it captures the look and feel of games I played in my childhood.  Looks, sounds and feels like an old-school arcade game.  Music, design, moves... everything.  Well crafted to recreate the experience.  For the whole Kung Fury experience (movie and promotions) their attention to detail, design, look and feel is phenomenal.

Cool dodgy 80's arcade music, combos, timing and the greatest cop of all time... it's a lot of fun.  And for the price... anyone who complains should take a long hard look at what value they bring to the world.  These guys have brought the past back to life for the same cost of a quick arcade game.  Fun, fast and yeah.  It's a basic arcade button, masher, combo and timing driven game.  For any child of the 80's it's a must!

It's awesome.  I love it and have had a ton of fun with it.  This is my first review on Steam because I want to support these guys for delivering an innovative passion project to the world.

So if you're thinking about it, just do it.  Go on and crack some skulls Streets of Rage style and enjoy.

16087000.review:
Neat game, but it has a fundamental mechanics problem. 

Once it gets a little cluttered and you run into a host of different enemies you are unable to fight them in the way you`re supposed to ... 

What I mean is ... every enemy has its specific button combination to deal with him (nazitrooper=1strike, blonde nazicaptain=2 strikes in the same direction, nurses=leftrightleft or vice versa  rightleftright etc) - problem is once you have 2 types of special enemies, that need conflicting ways to be dealt with, you have no choice but to take a hit at some point, no way to play around it - maybe by breaking your combo by dashing ... which would be AGAIN counterintuitive to the game mechanic of "buildiung up a high combolevel" 

PRO:
- overall vibe
- the retro look
- the NewRetroWave Soundtrack
- in principle a good core mechanic idea stripped down to the bare minimum (2 buttons and a combo-meter)

CONTRA:
- the core-mechanics do not play out by design

OVERALL:
- overall a fun timekiller and 1,99€ well spent

16082520.review:
Unlike the movie this game keeps it simple and has some substance to it. How does it play? It plays like one of those dance rythm games at the arcade where you need to step on the arrows as they fall, except with a bit of a twist. Only 2 buttons instead of 4 or 8, and enemies instead of falling arrows. But the different 'types' of enemiesis what makes it interesting. Because of the different enemies the game goes from being "hit (direction) button as enemy approaches" to being "read the situation and handle it accordingly". You really start having to think how you need to handle different combinations of enemies as they approach and pulling off a large combo and getting a high score feels really satisfying.

BUT: the range of your attacks feels too short at times and it feels overly punishing, and I swear the female Nazis glitch and attack faster in certain situations. Possible that its all just in my head.

16082301.review:
Just like probably a lot of other people, I bought the game mainly to support the whole Kung Fury project. Still the game turned out to be actually pretty fun albeit a bit barren in terms of modes and gameplay in general. Basically it's a One Finger Death Punch clone but without the cool campaign mode... or the online leaderboards... or the nifty power ups and upgrades... yeah, its as barren as it gets (I don't think there is even a way to customize the controls or even use a gamepad). 

Still the 80s vibes are awesome, the music is pretty rad, and of course you get to be Kung Fury, the best renegade cop of the last 30 years. 

Gameplay wise, if you haven't played One Finger Death Punch, the game is quite simple. You have a left side attack and a right side attack. Enemies come from both sides and you have to kill them before they hit you. Three hits and you are dead. Simple as that but quite addicting, especially in small dosages. 

Given the price of admission, give the game a chance. It's fun despite not having that much content.

16078950.review:
It's just stupid fun and nostalgic. I grew up in this era so I can relate to the nonsense going on. For two dollars, you can't really beat it, you have to be pretty hard up for cash if you complain about the price. 

The game gets pretty challenging as it's all about timing and reflexes and of course, beating the high score, which was what arcade games were all about. It get's insanely addicting when you start to get high combo's and different style of enemies litter the screen.

My only gripe with the game is that sometimes the controls act really wonky and only the right attack button will work. At first I thought this was intentional, like the developers were trying to emulate broken buttons or something but after a while I realized it's definitely a glitch in the programming... or maybe it might be faulty button emulation.. who know's really.

I usually have to die 5 or 6 times or reset the game completely in order for the left attack button to work... and yes I try everything, it just doesn't register any of the left attack buttons. D-pad, buttons and mouse, none of them work when the game first boots up... 

Once the left button starts to work, it's fine though... just really obnoxious... probably needs a patch.
Watch the movie or this won't make any sense at all.

16075767.review:
Kung fury is a fun little game, advertising for the movie of the same name. The game tries to emulate the feel of an old arcade machine, and does so fairly well.
It plays out in the same fashion as "One finger death punch" that you only have to use two buttons to hit the incoming enemies at varying degrees. While that doesn´t subtract from the game, Kung Fury does not have a margin of the same amount of content as OFDP, even if it is half the price. They could have removed the arcade feel, added some of the OFDP ui elements to see enemies health and such - or just made it an option which one to pick - and it would have improved a lot.

With that said would I still recommend this game? Yes, it is a fun game. Would I however tell people to pay for it - no. I do not feel it is worth the current price with the lacking content.

16074805.review:
Неплохой таймкиллер, вышедший с целью рекламы крутого фильма Kung Fury.
В игре присутствует два режима игры сюжетный, и в котором мы бесконечно будем раскидывать толпы нацистов и их роботов на право и налево. (С целью набивания очков).
Сам геймплей прост - всего две кнопки управления. Но тем не менее получаются забавные цепочки убийств. Например сначала мы раскидываем всех своим Кунг-Фу, далее достаем пистолет и расстреливаем врагов, а потом разбиваем им головы ногами. Постепенно появляются новые, более сложные враги.
Все сделано в стиле старых игровых автоматов, плюс стильная музычка.
К слову, можете опоробовать на Android и iOS совершенно бесплатно. А можно поддержать создателей фильма, и потратить 60 рублей на эту замечательную игру.

16070245.review:
I bought the game to support the movie, but having played the game, I feel like it was worth even more than $2.00.  The game sets up a sense of playing an arcade machine aesthetically. For as much as I've played this already, I must have sunk two fistfuls of virtual quarters into this sucker.

At first glance (and partly due to the namesake of the subtitle) you come in expecting it to be a button mashing sidescroller but it isn't anything like that. It plays more like a beat rhythm game where the music is replaced with the heart beat of the warrior inside you. Time your strikes, methodically dismantle each type of enemy, and, most importantly, never miss a blow.  Those who've played One Finger Death Punch will find the mechanics familiar, others should be able to catch on quickly.  

Don't stop until you've at least beaten The Hoff!
